FNR


  • The presence of apoFNR in aerobically and anaerobically grown E. coli was analyzed in situ using thiol reagents . [18055593]
  • The presence of one or two accessible residues in anaerobic cells suggests that the bacteria contain some apoFNR . [18055593]

  • Mutationalchanges , with respect to the parentalsequence , are double underlined.I I I Wild-typeCRP bindingsite ; ~ m , JH , Derivative of CC-CC ansB Ps containingtwo symmetry-relatedpoint mutationsthat change each CRP half site ; ~ FNR bindingsite ; Derivativeof FF-FF anaBPecontainingtwo symmetry-relatedpoint mutationsthat change each FNR half site . [8748035, 8748035]
  • The question arises as to the involvement of the different activating regions in CRP and FNR at promoters in which both CRP and FNR function in tandem in various combinations , such as in the ansB promoters of Salmonella and Escherichia coil ( Jennings and Beacham , 1993 ; Jennings et aL , 1993 ; see below ) . [8748035]
  • [ 20 ] Scott , S. , Busby , S. and Beacham , I. ( 1995 ) Transcriptional co-acti-vation at the ansB promoters : involvement of the activating regions of CRP and FNR when bound in tandem . [14612240]
  • [ 149 ] Scott , S. , Busby , S. and Beacham , I. ( 1995 ) Transcriptional co-acti-vation at the ansB promoters : involvement of the activating regions of CRP and FNR when bound in tandem . [14638413]
  • Scott , S. , Busby , S. , and Beacham , I. ( 1995 ) Transcriptional co-activation at the ansB promoters : involvement of the activating regions of CRP and FNR when bound in tandem . [9767578]
  • Transcriptional co-activation at the ansB promoters : involvement of the activating regions of CRP and FNR when bound in tandem . [9308170, 9000616, 14996792, 9135111, 10715008, 19060147, 9852003, 15995204, 16166533, 10894724, 10601201, 10894725]
  • Two dimers of FNR bound in tandem can activate a mutant derivative of ansB Pe in a co-dependent manner A mutant derivative of ansB Pe in which the upstream site had been changed from a CRP to an FNR site , i.e. FF-FF , was functional ( Table 3 ) and , as expected , CRP-independent in contrast to the native promoter , CC-FF ( Jennings and Beacham , 1993 ; see Fig. 1B and Table 4 ) . [8748035]
  • We conclude that , at the ansB promoters , AR1 is required when CRP binds upstream ( around -- 91 ) , whether functioning together with downstream FNR in a co-dependent manner , or with CRP downstream in a synergistic manner . [8748035]
  • Consistent with other studies ( Busby et aL , 1994 ; 1995 ) , AR1 in CRP is required at both upstream and downstream binding sites in all ` versions ' of the ansB promoters with CRP sites ; the CC-FF and FF-CC promoters specifically demonstrate a requirement upstream and downstream , respectively , when binding in tandem with FNR . [8748035]
  • Ferredoxin ( ﬂavodoxin ) : NADP oxidoreductase ( FNR ) was discovered in þ E. coli as an NADPH-dependent reductant of Fld1 that facilitated generation of active methionine synthase in vitro ; FNR and Fld1 will also supply electrons for the reductive cleavage of AdoMet essential for generating protein or substrate radicals in pyruvate formate-lyase , class III ribonucleotide reductase , biotin synthase , and , potentially , lipoyl synthase . [12234497]
  • Spectral changes are normalized to facilitate Discussion In E. coli , FNR plays important roles in enzyme activation , providing electrons from the cellular NADPH pool for reductive methylation of cobalamin in methionine synthase [ 1 ] , for glycyl radical generation in class III ribonucleotide reductase [ 18 ] , and pyruvate formate-lyase [ 16 ] , and for substrate radical generation in biotin synthase [ 4 ] and probably the homologous enzyme lipoyl synthase [ 53 ] . [12234497]
  • 174 , No. 11 Anaerobic Induction of Pyruvate Formate-Lyase Gene E Is Mediated by the ArcA and FNR Proteins xpression GARY SAWERS * AND BERNHARD SUPPMANN Lehrstuhlftir Mikrobiologie der Universitat Munchen , Maria-Ward-Strasse la , 8000 Munich 19 , Gernany Received 16 December 1991/Accepted 26 March 1992 The pyruvate formate-lyase ( pfl ) gene of Escherichia coli is transcribed from seven promoters which are coordinately induced 12 - to 15-fold by anaerobiosis . [1592804]
  • However , it is further repressed and inhibited during fermentative growth and fumarate respiration , when the conversion of pyruvate to acelyl-CoA increasingly depends on pyruvate formate-lyase , the pyruvate-inducible product of the FNR - and ArcA-dependent pfl gene ( Sawers and Suppmann , 1992 ) . [7783622]

  • Biochemistry 2004 , 43 , 791-798 791 Superoxide Destroys the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + Cluster of FNR from Escherichia coli † Victoria R. Sutton , ‡ , Audria Stubna , § Thomas Patschkowski , Eckard Münck , § Helmut Beinert , ⊥ and Patricia J. Kiley * , Program in Cellular & Molecular Biology , UniVersity of Wisconsin , and Department of Biomolecular Chemistry , Medical School , UniVersity of Wisconsin , 1300 UniVersity AVenue , Madison , Wisconsin 53706 , Department of Chemistry , Carnegie Mellon UniVersity , 4400 Fifth AVenue , Pittsburgh , PennsylVania 15213 , and Institute for Enzyme Research and Department of Biochemistry , College of Agriculture and Life Sciences , UniVersity of Wisconsin , Madison , Wisconsin 53705 ReceiVed September 21 , 2003 ; ReVised Manuscript ReceiVed NoVember 12 , 2003 ABSTRACT : The oxygen sensing ability of the transcription factor FNR depends on the presence of a [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster .   • Iron-sulfur cluster disassembly in the FNR protein of Escherichia coli by O2 : [ 4Fe-4S ] to [ 2Fe-2S ] conversion with loss of biological activity ABSTRACT The transcription factor FNR ( fumarate nitrate reduction ) requires the presence of an iron-sulfur ( Fe-S ) cluster for its function as a global transcription regulator in Escherichia coli when oxygen becomes scarce . [9177174]

  • , two Synechocystis species ; NtcA Sy3 , Svnechococcus species ; NtcA Sy7 , Synechococcus species ; PrfA Li , Listeria ivanovii ; PflA Lm , Listeria mono ~ wtogenes ; PtrA Sy , ~ vnechococcus species ; Vfr Pa , Pseudomonas aeruk , inosa ; Ycf Pp , Porphyra purpurea : YeiL Ec , Escherichia coli ( 3 ) have a predicted DNA-binding specificity corresponding to that of FNR rather than CRP ; ( 4 ) fail to respond to cAMP ; ( 5 ) respond to oxygen limitation ; and ( 6 ) retain all or most of the characteristic ` cysteine signature ' of FNR , which comprises three essential N-terminal cysteine residues and a fourth essential cysteine within the [ 3-roll . [11407111]
  • A protein which is related to both FNR and CRP may be assigned to the FNR family on the basis of : - an ability to complement anfnr mutation in E. coli , or its equivalent in another organism ; - a greater degree of sequence identity to FNR than to CRP ; - h a v i n g the predicted DNA-binding specificity of FNR rather than that of CRP ; - failing to respond to cAMP , or lacking amino acids which are involved in liganding cAMP ; - responding to the same physiological signal as FNR , namely oxygen limitation or - retaining some or all of the cysteine residues of FNR which are thought to be involved in its response to oxygen limitation , and which are absent from CRP . [7747934]

  • Summary FNR Is a transcriptional-regulator that controls gene expression in response to oxygen limitation in Escherichia coii . [8065261]
  • Despite the vast abundance of genes that are regulated by the FNR and ArcAB systems , it appears that they do not represent the sole means by which gene expression in E. coli is regulated in response to oxygen levels ( Sawers , 1999 ) . [11251844]

  • This unusual use of FNR and OxyR to activate expression suggests that yhjA plays a speciﬁc role in countering oxidative-stress in E. coli , possibly in particular micro-aerobic environments . [17464064]

Busby1 School of Biosciences , University of Birmingham , Birmingham B15 2TT , United Kingdom ,1 and Department of Microbiology and Immunology , Stritch School of Medicine , Loyola University Chicago , Maywood , Illinois 601532 Received 5 July 2006/Accepted 16 August 2006 The Escherichia coli K-12 nrf operon promoter can be activated fully by the FNR protein ( regulator of fumarate and nitrate reduction ) binding to a site centered at position 41.5 .   • Regulation by Nucleoid-Associated Proteins at the Escherichia coli nir Operon Promoter Douglas F. Browning , * Jeffrey A. Cole , and Stephen J. W. Busby School of Biosciences , University of Birmingham , Birmingham B15 2TT , United Kingdom Received 23 July 2008/Accepted 22 August 2008 The Escherichia coli K-12 nir operon promoter can be fully activated by binding of the regulator of fumarate and nitrate reduction ( FNR ) to a site centered at position 41.5 upstream of the transcript start , and this activation is modulated by upstream binding of the integration host factor ( IHF ) and Fis ( factor for inversion stimulation ) proteins . [18757534]

  • What is the physiological significance of the pfl operon being under the dual control of ArcA and FNR ? [1592804]
  • Expression of the operon is also induced anaerobically , although this regulation does not rely on direct control by either FNR or ArcA . [11251844]
  • When FNR activity was assayed over a range of oxygen concentrations in vivo [ 41,42 ] , the amount of oxygen required to inactivate half of the FNR in these cultures was in the range of 1 ^ 10 WM. At this external O2 concentration , Unden and colleagues have estimated that O2 di ¡ usion into cells exceeds the rate of cellular consumption thus providing su $ cient O2 to inactivate FNR which is present at a concentration of approximately 1 WM. Only when the external oxygen concentration drops below 1 WM is the oxygen concentration inside the cells predicted to be lower than the external oxygen concentration thus providing an environment where FNR will be no longer inactivated [ 42,43 ] . [9990723]
  • FNR can be inactivated in vivo and in vitro by iron-depletion , and active and inactive forms can be interconverted reversibly by Fe availability ( Spiro et al. 1989 ; Trageser and Unden 1989 ; Engel et al. 1991 ; Green and Guest 1993a , b ) . [8588737]
  • 1989 ) , from in vivo and in vitro KMnO4 footprinting studies ( Green and Guest , 1993a ) , and from the recent reactivation of iron-depleted FNR by Fe ^ ' and p-mercaptoethanol ( Green and Guest , 1993b ) , Furthermore , in vivo studies have shown that the active ( anaerobic ) and inactive ( aerobic ) forms of FNR are interconvertible depending on the availability of iron and oxygen ( Engel ef ai , 1991 ) and that FNR responds to redox state rather than oxygen per se ( Unden ef ai . [8065261]
  • That FNR binds to this proposed FNR-binding site and activates transcription has been demonstrated in vitro ( Green ef al. , 1991 ; Sharrocks ef al. , 1991 ) . [7934836]

[17293415]

Kiley2 * Program in Cellular & Molecular Biology ,1 Department of Biomolecular Chemistry ,2 and Institute for Enzyme Research , Department of Biochemistry ,3 University of Wisconsin , Madison , Wisconsin * Corresponding author . [15547274]
  • To simplify comparisons of isolated mutant and wild-type ( WT ) proteins , we constructed FNR-AR mutations in the context of FNR-D154A , a constitutively active mutant form of FNR that retains activity in the presence of O2 ( Kiley and Reznikoff , 1991 ; Ziegelhoffer and Kiley , 1995 ) . [11115116]
  • Indeed , there is evidence for the coexistence of oxidized and reduced forms both in isolated samples of FNR and in vivo , where the proportion of the oxidized form increases in aerobic organisms , and for the existence of a covalently modified species of FNR with an unknown substituent ( Green etai . [8065261]
  • If this is the case , then there must be a mechanism for NO induction of hmpA in aerobic cultures that involves neither MetR nor FNR ( which is inactive in the presence of oxygen ) and that mechanism is presumably the one described here involving YjeB . [16428390]
  • However , no speci cents c spectral features were observed by electronic or EPR spectroscopy nor was any labile sul - cents de found , which excluded the presence of Fe-S clusters in the aerobic FNR preparations [ 16,17 ] . [9990723]
  • Even though little activity could be attributed to the presence of Fe in aerobic FNR preparations , it was nevertheless considered , at that time , that a mono-nuclear Fe thiolate of the rubredoxin type ( FeCys4 ) [ 23 ] was present , which might be oxidized in inactive FNR and reduced in active FNR ( discussed in [ 4,5 ] ) . [9990723]
  • The net effect of exposing anaerobic FNR to oxygen is the rapid conversion of dimeric , DNA-binding , [ 4Fe-4S ] ~ + - containing FNR protein to an inactive [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + form that subsequently decays to the monomeric apo-protein . [11407111]
  • The transition from active FNR containing cubic [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + clusters to inactive forms , having planar [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + clusters or no clusters , presumably involves substantial rearrangement of the essential cysteine ligands , which in turn could drive the dimer-monomer transition and thus inactivate the transcriptionally active DNA-binding protein . [11407111]
  • The [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 form of FNR ( called 2Fe-FNR ) is monomeric in solution and is inactive for DNA binding and transcriptional regulation ( 19 , 28 ) . [15547274]
  • ApoFNR , like [ 2Fe-2S ] FNR , is inactive in DNA binding and gene regulation ( 14 ) . [18055593]
  • The [ 2Fe-2S ] 21 cluster form of FNR was much more stable to oxygen , but was unable to sustain biological activity ( e.g. , DNA binding ) . [9177174]
  • In the presence of O2 , FNR is converted into a monomeric , non-DNA-binding form containing a [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 cluster . [19261852]
  • Nevertheless , this [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster species of FNR was inactive for site-specific DNA binding and appeared to be in a monomeric form ( 3 ) . [14730984]
  • FNR , another Fe -- S transcription factor in E. coli , only forms dimers and binds DNA in the presence of its oxygen-labile [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster .8,31 SoxR , a [ 2Fe -- 2S ] - containing transcription activator in the MerR family , can bind its single target DNA site in the presence or absence of its Fe -- S cluster . [19361432]
  • The effect of DNA binding on the rate of cluster conversion was determined by measuring O-2 induced Fe2 release from 4Fe-FNR in the presence of 34-bp dsDNA containing the consensus FNR-binding site . [15547274]
  • The presence of the Fe-S cluster in the anaerobically purified form of FNR is correlated with an increase in dimerization and specific DNA binding ( 3 ) , compared with the aerobically purified form that lacks an Fe-S cluster ( 2 , 5 , 6 ) . [9177174]
  • We report here the unexpected observation that the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster of FNR is converted in less than 5 min to a [ 2Fe-2S ] cluster in about 60 % yield as judged from Mössbauer spectra and this conversion results in a reduction in DNA-binding ability . [9177174]
  • While it is known that the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster of FNR is required for DNA binding , we are not aware of any experiments that have addressed whether DNA binding inﬂuences the rate of O - induced [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster conversion . [15547274]
  • To provide further evidence that the decrease in specific DNA binding is a consequence of a loss of the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster , a time course of the oxygen-induced inactivation of FNR was first established by measuring the amount of specific DNA binding as a function of time of FNR incubation in air ( Fig. 2 ) . [9177174]
  • As described below , the association of a [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster in FNR increases site-speci cents c DNA binding of FNR by increasing the ability of FNR to dimerize . [9990723]
  • Rather it appears that the form of FNR as isolated ( [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster ) is the relevant form and the presence of this cluster stabilizes a conformation of FNR that is able to dimerize and bind DNA site-speci cents cally . [9990723]
  • The [ 4Fe ± 4S ] 2 + cluster of FNR is oxygen labile and controls protein dimerization and site-speci ® c DNA binding . [12093725]
  • The loss of this cluster as well as the loss of specific DNA binding upon exposure of FNR to oxygen suggested that the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster , through its intrinsic instability , serves as an oxygen sensor . [9177174]
  • The presence of the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster increases dimerization of FNR which is correlated with an increase in site-specific DNA binding of FNR , a property expected of transcription factors of the FNR/CRP family . [9990723]
  • The ability of FNR to function as a transcription factor depends on the integrity of a [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster , which promotes a conformation that is necessary for FNR dimerization , site-speciﬁc DNA binding , and transcriptional regulation ( 12 , 16 , 19 , 21 ) . [15547274]
  • Assembly of the [ 4Fe -- 4S ] 2 + cluster results in simultaneous FNR dimerization and activity of speciﬁc DNA binding and transcription regulation [ 3 ] . [22326866]
  • This property of IscR was surprising since other known Fe -- S transcription factors ( e.g. , FNR , SoxR ) have only one type of site that either does ( FNR ) or does not ( SoxR ) require the Fe -- S cluster for DNA binding .8,9 The proposed Fe -- S ligands for IscR ( Cys92 , Cys98 , and Cys104 ) are distal to the predicted DNA-binding site ( Fig. 1 ) , and upon anaerobic isolation , the cluster is partially reduced ( [ 2Fe -- 2S ] 1 + - IscR ) but is readily oxidized in air to [ 2Fe -- 2S ] 2 + - IscR .1 Because IscR appears to require its Fe -- S cluster for regulation of PiscR and not for PsufA , this raises the question of whether IscR requires its [ 2Fe -- 2S ] cluster for regulation of other Type 2 promoters . [19361432]
  • Nevertheless , if the acquisition of the iron -- sulphur is not simply fortuitous or for purely structural purposes , cluster assembly and the potential for reversible disulphide and dimer formation could provide functional switches for DNA-binding and transcription regulation analogous to those operating in FNR and FLP . [11101674]
  • As the dimerization and DNA-binding functions of FNR require a functional [ 4Fe-4S ] iron-sulfur center that is destroyed by exposure to oxygen ( Khoroshilova et al. , 1997 ) , both of the pathways for nitrate reduction to ammonia are expressed only during anaerobic-growth . [22029434]
  • Under anaerobic conditions , acquisition of 1 [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster per FNR protomer causes dimerization and enhances site-specific DNA binding ( 15 ) . [19261852]
  • Previously , we observed that brief exposure of anaerobic FNR preparations to air caused a decrease in both specific DNA binding and the absorption spectrum characteristic of a [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster ( 3 ) . [9177174]
  • Despite lacking two of the N-terminal cysteine residues that are essential in FNR , FlpA was found to acquire [ 4Fe-4S ] clusters under anaerobic conditions and their incorporation was accompanied by the loss of the DNA-binding activity ( Scott et al. , 2000 ) . [11407111]
  • However , under anaerobic conditions a dimeric form of FNR with two [ 4Fe -- 4S ] clusters per dimer that is capable of enhanced site-specific DNA binding is predominant ( Jervis & Green , 2007 ; Lazazzera et al. , 1996 ) . [20522491]
  • Under anaerobic conditions FNR contains a [ 4Fe -- 4S ] cluster that promotes dimerization of the protein and enhances site-speciﬁc DNA binding ( Lazazzera et al. , 1996 ) . [17464064]
  • In contrast to WT-FNR , FNR-D154A does not require a [ 4Fe24S ] cluster 21 for dimerization and DNA binding under aerobic conditions ( Ziegelhoffer and Kiley , 1995 ; Lazazzera et al. , 1996 ) . [11115116]
  • Therefore , aerobically purified FNR-D154A-AR derivatives provide a dimerization-competent form of FNR , which avoids the complication of obtaining uniform Fe ± S cluster occupancy in each FNR-AR mutant protein that would otherwise be necessary for the comparison of mutant phenotypes under anaerobic conditions ( Lazaz-zera et al. , 1993 ; Ziegelhoffer and Kiley , 1995 ) . [11115116]
  • To correlate DNA-binding ability with the amount of the Fe-S cluster present in FNR , we examined changes in the Fe-S cluster content after exposure of the protein to air by UV-visible , EPR , and Mössbauer spectros-copies and by analyses for Fe , inorganic sulfide , and protein . [9177174]
  • Interestingly , the A3 subdomain of HyfR contains a cysteine-rich segment ( - C-X , - H-C-X-C-X-P-X-C-X-P - ; Fig. 4 ) which could serve as a binding site for a metal cofactor or iron-sulphur cluster , endowing the HyfR protein with the ability to respond to changes in redox and/or oxygen status as for the FNR , IRP and SoxR transcriptional-regulator proteins ( Hidalgo et al. , 1995 ; Rouault & Klausner , 1996 ) . [9387241]
  • DNA binding by the ( mutated ) FNR * protein is enhanced when the Fe-S center is reduced ( Khoroshilova et al. 1995 ) . [8588737]
  • FNR senses anaerobiosis through the acquisition of an oxy-gen-labile [ 4Fe -- 4S ] cluster , which promotes dimerization of the protein and enhances site-speciﬁc DNA binding ( Lazzazera et al. , 1996 ; Jordan et al. , 1997 ; Popescu et al. , 1998 ) . [11932447]
  • The maximal amount of target DNA that was specifically bound by anaerobically purified FNR using these solution conditions was typically between 50 and 70 % ; higher protein concentrations led to the formation of nonspecific protein -- DNA complexes ( 15 ) , which were not quantified in this study . [9177174]
  • The DA154 substitution in this FNR protein has been shown to enhance dimer stability , thus providing a sufficiently active form of FNR for use in gel retardation analysis under oxic conditions ; it has been widely used to simplify the in vitro analysis of FNR -- DNA interactions [ 16,32 ] . [18683632]
  • FNR was cross-linked to its DNA-binding sites in cultures of bacteria during exponential-growth under different conditions , and the precipitated protein-DNA complex was probed for the presence of target promoters . [16377617]
  • Although it is not obvious why these two proteins should have different properties , the reconstituted protein was reported to be unstable in the presence of ferrous and ferric chelators , in contrast to native 4Fe-FNR , which is stable under anaerobic conditions to either the Fe3 - speciﬁc chelator Tiron ( data not shown ) or the Fe2 - speciﬁc chelator ferene . [15547274]
  • The attenuated lytic activity of BEU705 could be restored both with and without the presence of oxygen by the introduction of CRP on a plasmid ( pDW300 ) , and to some extent , under anaerobic conditions only , by the introduction of FNR ( plasmid pGS24 ) or altered FNR proteins having CRP binding speciﬁcities ( plasmids pGS215 and pGS297 ) . [11053378]
  • Further mutagenic and structural studies will be needed to support this prediction and to identify other residues that contact DNA and define the DNA-binding specificity of FLE A major difference that might explain the divergent DNA-binding specificities of FNR and FLP is the presence of proline as the first residue of the DNA-recognition helix in FLP ( Fig. 4 ) . [11407111]
  • In particular , substitution to Ala at position 154 increases dimerization of apoFNR ( FNR lacking any Fe or S23 ) and thus allows FNR to function in the presence of oxygen [ 20,26 ] . [9990723]
  • b-galactosidase assay of FNR dependent PydfZ-lacZ showed that the tandem FNR dimer exhibit 3-fold higher transcription activity than that of single copy ( Fig. 2 ) , suggesting that covalently linking of two FNR molecules can improve its activity in the presence of oxygen presumably because of enhanced protein dimerization . [22326866]
  • To screen for variant with further enhanced activity , we introduced D154A substitution which has been demonstrated to enhance dimerization between two FNR monomers in the presence of oxygen . [22326866]
  • In the presence of oxygen , the cluster disintegrates , and the protein no longer specifically binds DNA2 ~ Thus , FNR provides a clear example in which a reactive iron-sulfur cluster is used to sense concentrations of the destabilizing agent , oxygen . [8871401]
  • A mutation , in the putative dimerisation domain of FNR , results in a greater proportion of the FNR protein being puri cents ed as a dimer that is better able to-bind DNA in the presence of oxygen . [10856643]
  • However , it is also important to note that developing the methodology for studying the WT protein was greatly aided by earlier studies on proteins from FNR * mutants that alter the oxygen sensitivity of FNR [ 13,20,25 ] Of great interest is the mechanism by which the presence of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster senses oxygen availability and controls FNR dimerization and DNA binding . [9990723]
  • FNR senses the presence of oxygen by disassembly of its oxygen-sensitive iron-sulfur cluster , converting the protein to a non ¬ DNA-binding monomer ( 13 ) . [21252224]

  • Advantage was taken of the FNR * protein ( FNR-D154A ) which retains some activity in the presence of oxygen and has been widely used to simplify in vitro analyses of FNR : DNA interactions [ 19 ] . [14612240]
  • Direct evidence of FNR binding to the yfgF promoter was obtained by EMSA with an FNR protein ( FNR-D154A , designated FNR * ) that retains some DNA-binding activity in the presence of air ( Ziegelhoffer & Kiley , 1995 ) . [20522491]
  • To simplify the experiments an FNR protein ( FNR-D154A , referred to as FNR * ) that retains some DNA-binding activity in the presence of air was used ( Ziegelhoffer & Kiley , 1995 ) . [17464064]
  • In the presence of increasing amounts of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR protein ( 0 to 500 nM ) , the amount of fnr transcript decreased in a concentration-dependent manner , whereas no effect on the amount of RNA-1 transcript was observed . [17293415]
  • [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR ( 4Fe-FNR ) concentrations are given from left to right in terms of nM total protein : 100 , 200 , and 400 . [17293415, 17293415]
  • By quantifying the amount of [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster in 2Fe-FNR in vitro in the presence of various reductants and oxidants ( GSH , DTT , cysteine , O2 , hydrogen peroxide , and superoxide ) , we found that superoxide , a byproduct of aerobic metabolism , significantly destabilized the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster . [14730984]
  • However , it is not obvious why super-oxide-mediated destruction of the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster of FNR is necessary since 2Fe-FNR is already inactive for transcriptional regulation . [14730984]
  • This opens up the question of whether the 2Fe cluster of FNR is as stable in vivo . [9990723]
  • Nonetheless , whether it is the 2Fe form or apoprotein ( or some combination of both ) that is the substrate in vivo , activation of FNR will likely require additional proteins that facilitate Fe-S cluster assembly . [9990723]
  • Thus , since both sulfur and Fe are released from the cluster upon reaction with superoxide , we conclude that the attack by superoxide on the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster of FNR is likely to be more complex than that of the hydrolyase clusters from which no sulfur is released . [14730984]
  • In spinach chloroplasts , photosystem I reduces the 1/2 2Fe -- 2S 2þ cluster in Fd , and reduced Fd shuttles this electron to FNR [ 31 ] . [12234497]
  • It is impossible from the present experiments to ascertain whether this band is due to changes in the FAD cofactor in FNR or in the 1/2 2Fe -- 2S 2þ cluster in Fd . [12234497]
  • No repression of fnr was observed in vivo or in vitro with the apoprotein form of FNR , indicating that repression requires the dimeric , Fe-S cluster-containing protein . [17293415]
  • DISCUSSION FNR requires a Fe-S cluster for its regulatory functions as a transcription factor and in vitro is inactivated within a few minutes when exposed to air . [9177174]
  • However , the domain containing the L-roll structure is involved in regulation of FNR activity , since it contains Cys122 , and this Cys appears to be one of the ligands for the Fe-S cluster . [9990723]
  • However , it is unknown whether the FNR that was activated following the shift arose from apo-FNR , which was generated by cluster degradation , or from newly synthesized FNR , which had yet to acquire a Fe-S cluster . [15547274]
  • ( E ) When the NO concentration is reduced , putative Fe ± S cluster-repairing mechan-isms can reconstitute the NO sensor , FNR . [12093725]
  • By oxidation of the FeS cluster , FNR is converted to the inactive state in a reversible process . [9230919]
  • FNR possesses a cysteine cluster to which iron ( Fe ( H ) ) binds only in the active form [ 2,6 ] . [8119409]
  • To define the oxidation state and type of Fe-S cluster present in the active form of FNR , we have studied anaerobically purified FNR with Mössbauer spectroscopy . [9177174]
  • For specific binding of FNR to DNA sites in gel retardation or in vitro footprinting dimeric FNR is required w60 ,70,73,74,121 x. FNR is also inactivated in vivo by chelating agents or after loss of the FeS cluster upon isolation of FNR Žstep II . [9230919]
  • We also found that there was no detectable difference in the rate of O2-induced cluster conversion for FNR free in solution compared to its DNA-bound form . [15547274]
  • If FNR was inactivated by O2 in vivo using this same mechanism ( 12 , 16 , 19 ) , then we expect that the rate of inactivation in cells should be similar to the in vitro rate of cluster conversion taking into account the other kinetic steps involved in in vivo measurements of FNR activity , such as the time required for O2 diffusion into cells , FNR dissociation from ndh promoter DNA , transcription and translation of lacZ , and folding and assembly of - galactosidase . [15547274]
  • In addition , the rate of FNR inactivation was monitored in vivo by measuring the rate at which transcriptional regulation by FNR is lost upon the exposure of cells to O2 ; a comparison of the in vitro and in vivo rates of conversion suggests that O2-induced cluster conversion is sufﬁcient to explain FNR inactivation in cells . [15547274]
  • Determining the in vitro rates of cluster conversion also allowed us to assess whether these values were compatible with in vivo measurements of FNR inactivation . [15547274]
  • It has been shown , however , that ferricyanide is able in vivo and in vitro to promote inactivation of FNR function or [ 4Fe -- 4S ] FNR destruction in an artiﬁcial reaction ( Unden et al. , 1990 ; Lazazzea et al. , 1996 ) , indicating that inactivation of FNR can also be achieved by oxidizing agents without direct need for O2 . [11931557]
  • The cluster ligands for the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster of FNR are presumed to be Cys20 , Cys23 , Cys29 and Cys122 since mutational analysis of these residues has shown that they are required for FNR function in vivo [ 10,12 ] and these mutant proteins lack iron and sul - cents de upon puri cents cation ( Khoroshilova et al. , unpublished data ) . [9990723]
  • The Fe was suggested to be present as a non-heme , non-sulfur cofactor , but recently in a mutant FNR protein a [ 3Fe-4S ] + cluster was detected ( Green et al. 1991 ; Khoroshilova et al. 1995 ) . [8588737]
  • The [ 4Fe -- 4S ] cluster is essential for O 2 2 + sensing , and is converted to a [ 2Fe -- 2S ] cluster ( [ 2Fe -- 2S ] FNR ) in the presence of O2 ( Kiley and Beinert , 1999 ; Khoroshilova et al. , 1995 , 1997 ; Green et al. , 1996 ) . [11931557]
  • In FNR prepared from aerobic cultures ( Green et al. , 1991 ) , the presence of small quantities of iron , as well as absorbance bands associated with iron-sulfur clusters , suggests that the 14Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster may be continuously assembled in FNR . [11407111]
  • The total cellular content of FNR is similar in aerobic and anaerobic bacteria , but the apo-form is by far the most abundant aerobi species whereas the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + form predominates anaerobically ( Engel et al. , 1991 ; Green et al. , 1991 ; Lazazzera et al. , 1996 ; Popescu et al. , 1998 ) . [11407111]
  • To address this possibility , the effects of NO on the [ 4Fe ± 4S ] 2 + clusters of FNR were investigated in vitro . [12093725]
  • Throughout the paper , reported 4Fe-FNR concentrations refer to the concentration of FNR molecules containing [ 4Fe-4S ] clusters . [15547274]
  • These data indicate that [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR binds only to the downstream site under the in vitro solution conditions used in this study . [17293415]
  • Effect of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR on Pfnr transcription in vitro . [17293415]
  • ( B ) Quantiﬁed data showing the amounts of in vitro transcription from Pfnr in the presence of increasing concentrations of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR . [17293415]
  • Through DNase I footprinting and in vitro transcription experiments , we observed that direct binding of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR to the predicted downstream FNR binding site is sufﬁcient for repression of the fnr promoter in vitro . [17293415]
  • Since the in vitro transcription assays were carried out under reaction conditions similar to those for the DNase I footprinting experiments , these data suggest that binding of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR to the downstream site is sufﬁcient to repress Pfnr transcription in vitro . [17293415]

  • Green , J. , Bennett , B. , Jordan , P. , Ralph , E.T. , Thomson , A.J. , and Guest , J.R. ( 1996 ) Reconstitution of the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster in FNR and demonstration of the aerobic-anaerobic switch in vitro . [11169114]
  • Green , J. , Bennett , B. , Jordan , P. , Ralph , E.T. , Thomson , A.J. and Guest , J.R. ( 1996 ) Reconstitution of the [ 4Fe ± 4S ] cluster in FNR and demonstration of the aerobic ± anaerobic transcription switch in vitro . [12093725]
  • Green , J. , Bennett , B. , Jordan , P. , Ralph , E.T. , Thomson , A.J. , and Guest , J.R. ( 1996a ) Reconstitution of the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster in FNR and demonstration of the aerobic-anaerobic transcription switch in vitro . [9767578]
  • If this is the case , then superoxide-mediated conversion of 2Fe-FNR to apo-FNR may make the inactivation of 4Fe-FNR irreversible under aerobic-growth conditions , preventing any transcriptional regulation by FNR . [14730984]
  • Therefore , we proposed that 4Fe-FNR is synthesized under aerobic-growth conditions but is then rapidly inactivated by O2-induced cluster conversion ( 4 ) . [14730984]
  • The absence of any measurable amount of Fe-S cluster within FNR in aerobically grown cells implies that both 4Fe-FNR and 2Fe-FNR are relatively unstable under aerobic-growth conditions . [14730984]
  • To address this question , we have developed a method for purifying 2Fe-FNR from whole cells , which has allowed us to examine whether significant amounts of 2Fe-FNR are present in aerobically grown cells and whether the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster is stable to oxidants found under aerobic-growth conditions . [14730984]
  • Moreover , if superoxide were the major contributor to the destruction of the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster of FNR under aerobic-growth conditions , the superoxide concentration would determine the levels of 2Fe-FNR that would be available for reactivation . [14730984]
  • This lability may explain the absence of the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster form of FNR under aerobic-growth conditions . [14730984]
  • One prediction of this hypothesis is that the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster form of FNR should accumulate under aerobic-growth conditions . [14730984]
  • Our earlier studies had suggested to us that the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster form of FNR might accumulate under aerobic-growth conditions . [14730984]
  • In vivo , only indirect evidence for the formation of apoFNR has been provided : the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 and [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 clusters of FNR are lacking in aerobically grown cells under conditions in which the FNR protein is still present * Corresponding author . [18055593]
  • The conversion of [ 4Fe-4S ] FNR to [ 2Fe-2S ] FNR was followed under pseudo-ﬁrst-order conditions ( with O2 in excess ) by measuring absor-bance changes at 420 nm . [19261852]
  • As a ﬁrst step , we developed an assay to monitor the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster to [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 cluster conversion under conditions where O2 could be added in excess relative to 4Fe-FNR and where product formation could be easily monitored in real time . [15547274]
  • In the presence of O2 , conversion of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster to a [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster inactivates FNR , but the fate of the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster in cells grown under aerobic conditions is unknown . [14730984]
  • The present study shows that the predominant form of FNR in aerobic cells is apo-FNR ( cluster-less FNR ) indicating that the [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster , like the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster , is not stable under these conditions . [14730984]
  • These results imply that the [ 2Fe-2S ] cluster of FNR , like the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster of FNR ( 4 , 10 , 11 ) , is unstable under aerobic-growth conditions . [14730984]
  • Furthermore , because the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster of FNR is not stable under aerobic conditions ( Khoroshilova et al. , 1997 ) , we also overexpressed the mutant protein FNR-L28H , whose [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster is more resistant to destruction by oxygen ( Bates et al. , 2000 ) . [23075318]
  • Under conditions of very low oxygen tension , most of FNR will be in the dimeric state and will contain the 4Fe cluster , with the remainder of FNR being in the monomeric state as apoprotein . [9990723]
  • To obtain oxygen stable FNR variants for in vitro characterizations , in this study , we utilized the approach of covalently linking two fnr alleles in tandem to promote their in situ dimerization in the absence of the [ 4Fe -- 4S ] 2 + cluster under aerobic conditions . [22326866]
  • Thus it seems likely that the anaerobic activation of FNR requires the de novo incorporation of a [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster into apo-FNR . [11407111]
  • Oxygen is sensed by the interconversion of the [ 4Fe-4S ] x + ( active anaerobic dimeric ) and apo ( inactive aerobic monomeric ) forms of FNR . [11407111]
  • FNR responds to anaerobiosis and attains its active state via the anaerobic incorporation of a [ 4Fe-4S ] centre ( Khoroshilova et a / . [8809757]
  • Taken together , negative autoregulation appears to provide an optimal balance of FNR protein levels , directing a new rate of synthesis of the FNR regulon under anaerobic conditions and allowing the efﬁcient inactivation of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR upon exposure to O2 . [17293415]
  • For comparison , culture aliquots were also prepared under conditions known to accumulate only 4Fe-FNR ( anaerobic ) or 2Fe-FNR ( O2 treated ) . [14730984]
  • Under anaerobic conditions , one mechanism that controls fnr expression is negative autoregulation by the active [ 4Fe-4S ] form of FNR . [17293415]
  • Thus , we hypothesize that under anaerobic conditions , negative autoregulation also prevents [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR from exceeding a critical level beyond which it can be efﬁciently inactivated . [17293415]
  • The presence of [ 2Fe-2S ] FNR instead of apoFN could possibly allow a rapid return to the [ 4Fe-4S ] FNR state upon reversal to anoxic conditions and thereby rapid restoration of anaerobic-growth . [18055593]
  • Since the overnight sparging step was omitted , we overproduced FNR under analogous anaerobic-growth conditions to establish that , during the 1 h induction with IPTG , sufficient 4Fe-FNR was formed to allow detection of cluster from the purified protein . [14730984]
  • To further enrich for the dimeric , cluster-containing form of FNR , the [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR preparation was subject to size exclusion chromatography under anaerobic conditions as previously described ( 40 ) and the pooled dimeric FNR protein fraction was analyzed for protein , iron , and sulﬁde content ( 2 , 26 , 27 ) . [17293415]
  • The oxygen lability of FNR protein is attributed to its oxygen sensing [ 4Fe -- 4S ] 2 + cluster , which is assembled into FNR during its de novo biosynthesis under anaerobic conditions . [22326866]
  • Because the Isc requirement for biogenesis of the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster of FNR is greater under aerobic than anaerobic conditions ( Mettert et al. , 2008 ) , we considered the possibility that acquisition of the [ 2Fe-2S ] cluster by IscR is reduced under aerobic conditions because of the competition with other substrates for the Isc machinery . [23075318]
  • As described in the following sections , a simple change in the redox state of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster to the expected 1 + oxidation state is not the physiologically relevant redox reaction for FNR ; the cluster is very di $ cult to reduce to the +1 oxidation state in vitro and no physiological electron donors or acceptors have been identi cents ed that would maintain the cluster in the +1 oxidation state under anaerobic conditions . [9990723]
  • No change in absorption at 593 nm was observed in a reaction of 4Fe-FNR with excess ferene under anaerobic conditions , demonstrating that the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster was stable to ferene under these conditions and that the release of Fe2 was O dependent , as ex-2 pected . [15547274]
  • Nevertheless , a variant of FNR ( FNRL28H ) with an O2-stable [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster accumulates intracellularly as the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster form under both aerobic and anaerobic conditions , suggesting that de novo assembly of clusters into wild-type FNR can occur under aerobic conditions ( 10 ) . [14730984]
  • Reduction of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster FNR puri cents ed under anaerobic conditions has been shown by Mo ëssbauer spectroscopy to contain a [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster in the 2 + form . [9990723]
  • At the low cell densities and the sparging conditions used in these studies , the dissolved O2 in the culture media ( 25 ° C ) was present in excess ( 220 M ) of the cellular [ FNR ] of 3.7 M ; accordingly , under these conditions , FNR inactivation rates should follow pseudo-ﬁrst order kinetics and can be extrapolated from Fig. 3 . [15547274]
  • These data also imply that at O2 levels in the range of microaerobic culture conditions , the rate of cluster conversion will be even slower , indicating that the amount of FNR active in cells at a particular dissolved [ O2 ] should be largely determined by its rate of inactivation . [15547274]
  • This process has been observed in vivo , but also in vitro after prolonged exposure of FNR to O2 w74 ,75,77 x. Mere oxidation of FNR might be the normal reaction to inactivate FNR in the aerobicranaerobic switch , but under some conditions loss of the FeS cluster could occur . [9230919]
  • While the O2-induced conversion of 4Fe-FNR to 2Fe-FNR is sufficient to explain how FNR in anaerobically grown E. coli is inactivated upon O2 exposure , less is known about how FNR in aerobically grown cells is kept in an inactive state . [14730984]
  • Crack JC , Green J , Cheesman MR , Le Brun NE , Thomson AJ ( 2007 ) Superoxide-mediated ampliﬁcation of the oxygen-induced switch from [ 4Fe-4S ] to [ 2Fe-2S ] clusters in the transcriptional-regulator FNR . [19261852]
  • In view of the ease , rapid rate and high yield of interconversion between the 4Fe and 2Fe clusters , the possibility that the 2Fe form has the same ligands as 4Fe-FNR seems most likely . [9990723]
  • Thus , in the microaerobic state , there is likely to be an equilibrium between three species , 4Fe , 2Fe and apo-FNR , with the 4Fe species being produced by biosynthesis pathways from apo and eventually being converted to 2Fe by oxygen . [9990723]
  • 2 Because the extinction coefﬁcient for the Fe - ferene complex 2 2 is much higher than that of either the [ 4Fe-4S ] or [ 2Fe-2S ] cluster , using Fe2 - ferene to monitor reaction progress offered the advantage that [ O ] could be varied over a wide range 2 while still maintaining O in excess of 4Fe-FNR , which was not 2 possible when monitoring changes in Fe-S cluster absorption in the visible region . [15547274]
  • Both systems become activated in response to anaerobiosis , but whereas FNR is a direct O2 sensor via an oxygen sensitive [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster , ArcB senses O2 availability indirectly by monitoring the redox state of the quinone pool ( 28 -- 30 ) . [20075074]
  • Although information is accumulating about the mechanism of [ 4Fe-4S ] > cluster disassembly in response to oxygen ( both in vivo and in vitro ) , tar less is known about the assembly of the iron-sulfur clusters in FNR during anaerobiosis . [11407111]
  • Reversal of cluster conversion When oxygen-treated FNR was made anaerobic and reduced by dithionite , Moëssbauer spectroscopy showed that the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster was regenerated in 90 % yield on the basis of total cluster iron , that is , two 2Fe clusters apparently reformed one 4Fe cluster [ 24 ] . [9990723]
  • In addition to providing a means for rapidly reaching steady-state levels of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR , the amount of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR protein produced by the negative autoregulation mechanism also seems optimal for the efﬁcient inactivation of FNR by O2 . [17293415]
  • In the absence of O2 , FNR binds a [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster ( ligated by Cys-20 , 23 , 29 , 122 ) promoting the formation of a transcriptionally active dimer . [19261852]
  • In addition to the synthesis of the FNR protein , such steps include the acquisition of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster , superoxide-induced conversion of 2Fe-FNR to apo-FNR , reconversion of 2Fe-FNR to 4Fe-FNR , and the possible recycling of the apo-FNR form to regenerate active 4Fe-FNR . [15547274]
  • We have thus further supported our proposed model for the function of FNR , namely that the active form of the FNR protein contains a [ 4Fe-4S ] 21 cluster , and that this cluster serves as the O2 sensor by virtue of its extreme sensitivity toward O2 . [9177174]
  • The primary mechanism of regulation is the direct inactivation of FNR via the O2-dependent destruction of its [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster , which is required for its activity ( 20 , 28 , 33 ) . [17293415]
  • To test whether the anaerobically functional dimer of ( FNRD154A ) 2 was still dependent on the [ 4Fe -- 4S ] 2 + cluster and thus retains the O2 sensing capability , we introduced C122A , which has been shown to abolish the [ 4Fe -- 4S ] 2 + cluster binding and transcription activity upon introduction to native FNR [ 16 ] . [22326866]
  • [ 14 ] E.L. Mettert , P.J. Kiley , ClpXP-dependent proteolysis of FNR upon loss of its O2-sensing [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster , J. Mol . [22326866]
  • Finally , we consistently ﬁnd , through numerous experiments of variable design , that the rate of the conversion of 4Fe-FNR to 2Fe-FNR , and the consequent release of Fe2 , is dependent on the concentration of O2 ; this ﬁnding is inconsistent with the proposal ( 7 ) that the rate-determining step in cluster conversion does not involve O2 . [15547274]
  • To induce the conversion of 4Fe-FNR to 2Fe-FNR , 10 mL of cells were diluted in 390 mL of buffer M and sparged with 100 % O2 for 15 min . [14730984]
  • Thus , at lower O2 concentrations that are still sufficient to inactivate 4Fe-FNR ( 30 ) , we propose that superoxide is unlikely to accumulate to levels sufficient to destroy 2Fe-FNR . [14730984]
  • 1 Abbreviations : 2Fe-FNR , [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster containing FNR ; 4Fe-2 + FNR , [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster containing FNR ; apo-FNR , cluster-less FNR ; DTT , dithiothreitol ; FNR , fumarate nitrate reduction ; GSH , glutathione ; IPTG , isopropyl-thio-â-D-galactoside . [14730984]
  • Direct reactivation of [ 4Fe -- 4S ] FNR from [ 2Fe -- 2S ] FNR has been demonstrated so far neither in vitro nor in vivo , and it is not known whether this reaction takes place . [11931557]
  • Our current understanding is that FNR is continually supplied with [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 clusters by the iron -- sulfur cluster biosynthetic machinery ( 25 -- 27 ) , but O2 converts the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster to a [ 3Fe-4S ] cluster that spontaneously disassembles to yield a [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 cluster with concomitant inactivation of FNR ( 12 , 15 , 22 , 23 ) . [19261852]
  • When O2 is supplied only brieﬂy or at low concentrations , inactivation of [ 4Fe-4S ] FNR might stop at the level of [ 2Fe-2S ] FNR . [18055593]
  • Upon exposure to O2 , FNR is inactivated by conversion of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + cluster to a [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + cluster , which produces the 2Fe-FNR form . [14730984]
  • DISCUSSION The kinetic data presented in this study provide key support for the model that [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 to [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 cluster conversion is sufﬁcient to explain how FNR is inactivated by O2 in vivo . [15547274]
  • The O2 sensitivity of FNR is also mediated by the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster ; in the presence of O , the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 2 cluster is converted to a [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 cluster both in vitro and in vivo ( 15 , 16 , 24 ) . [15547274]
  • The properties of [ 4Fe-4S ] FNR and [ 2Fe-2S ] FNR , their presence in aerobically and anaerobically growing E. coli in vivo and in vitro , and their signiﬁcance in O2 sensing are well documented . [18055593]
  • In the presence of O2 , the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster is converted to a [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 cluster , which inactivates FNR as a transcriptional-regulator . [15547274]
  • In the presence of O2 , [ 4Fe-4S ] FNR is converted to monomeric [ 2Fe-2S ] FNR , which is no longer active in gene regulation ( 6 , 7 , 12 , 18 , 24 ) . [18055593]
  • [ 7 ] A.J. Jervis , J.C. Crack , G. White , P.J. Artymiuk , M.R. Cheesman , A.J. Thomson , N.E. Le Brun , J. Green , The O2 sensitivity of the transcription factor FNR is controlled by Ser24 modulating the kinetics of [ 4Fe -- 4S ] to [ 2Fe -- 2S ] conversion , Proc . [22326866]
  • The transition from activeto inactiveprotein upon exposure to oxygen is a bipbasic process , in which oxygen catalytically drives the redox balanced conversion of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 + form to the inactive [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 + form , which in turn degrades to apo-FNR . [11407111]
  • nalysis of the Oxidative Conversion of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 of FNR to a [ 2Fe-2S ] 2 Cluster Kinetic A Cluster Received 20 May 2004/Accepted 31 August 2004 The ability of FNR to sense and respond to cellular O levels depends on its [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 2 cluster . [15547274]
  • Thus , apoFNR , which was reduced by DTT , and reconstituted [ 4Fe-4S ] FNR showed the same Mr of 34,000 after labeling by AMS , suggesting that AMS replaces the FeS cluster and labels FNR at up to ﬁve Cys residues . [18055593]
  • Thus , these data suggest that the FNR iron -- sulfur cluster is stabilized by the presence of Phe at position 24 . [19261852]
  • Thus , the presence of Phe at position 24 does not impair the ability of FNR to-bind an iron -- sulfur cluster with properties very similar to the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster acquired by wild-type FNR under the same conditions . [19261852]
  • The presence of the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster was required for FNR to-bind to the downstream site , since no enhancements or regions of protection were detected when equivalent amounts of apo-FNR were used in the assay ( Fig. 3A ) . [17293415]
  • The stoichiometry of iron and labile sulfide relative to the number of cysteine ligands of anaerobically purified FNR is most compatible with the presence of a [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster ( 3 ) . [9177174]
  • The [ 4Fe-4S ] 21 cluster of FNR was not reduced by dithionite , even at pH 9 and in the presence of methylviologen , indicating a very low redox potential . [9177174]
  • Previous analysis of an FNR mutant protein ( 2 ) suggests that sensitivity toward O2 is primarily determined by subtle details of protein structure , since substitution of Leu-28 for His allowed for purification in the presence of oxygen of FNR containing a [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster . [9177174]
  • However , it is not understood how the presence of the [ 4Fe-4S ] 2 cluster increases dimerization of FNR . [9990723]
  • If one accepts the structure of the CAP protein as model for that of FNR , then it seems that the presence of the [ 4Fe-4S ] cluster causes FNR to adopt a speci cents c conformation which is favorable for dimerization . [9990723]
  • In the presence of a range of initial [ O2 ] from 80 to 440 M , an average of 4.33 0.06 M Fe2 ions were reproducibly released from 2 M [ 4Fe-4S ] 2-FNR ( 8 M with respect to cluster sulﬁde and 9.84 M with respect to the initial cluster-bound Fe ) within 2 min in the presence of 100 M ferene ( Fig. 1 ; also data not shown ) . [15547274]
  • RESULTS In vivo negative autoregulation requires the presence of [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR . [17293415]
  • These data support th notion that negative autoregulation in vivo requires the presence of active [ 4Fe-4S ] - FNR . [17293415]
  • Our study showed that perturbation of the global regulator FNR and PurR function as well as increase in purine nucleotide availability , could affect the oxidative damage cell death pathway initiated by topoisomerase cleavage complex . [22152010]
  • For example , only residual Fe-S cluster-dependent activities were detected for IscR , fumarate nitrate regulator ( FNR ) , NsrR , glutamate synthase , isopropylmalate isomerase , NADH dehydrogenase I , and succinate dehydrogenase in strains lacking a functional Isc pathway ( 10 , 20 , 23 , 29 , 42 -- 44 ) . [25266384]

[1854188]
  • In those bacteria that possess more than one member of the DNR/FLP subgroup , problems due to cross-talk may not arise because the regulators appear to be expressed in response to different environmental stimuli ( Vollack et al. , 1999 ) and their active forms may therefore never coexist Despite possessing the same structural framework , differences in primary structure between CRP and FNR within , and probably outside , the DNA-recognition helix may sufficiently alter DNA-target recognition such that CRP and FNR are able to regulate distinct modulons whilst sharing the same cytoplasm . [11407111]

  • Transcription control of acs -- yjcH -- actP is complex and the intergenic region between acs and nrfA is bound by CRP , FNR , IHF , FIS and NarL or NarP and is folded into an ordered nucleoprotein structure that permits the two divergent promoters to be regulated independently ( Browning et al. 2002 ) . [17273855]
  • It has recently been reported that FNR negatively regulates several other genes in E. coli ( Sawers et al. , 1988 ) and it is anticipated that , in contrast to genes activated by FNR , the corres-ponding regulatory regions will contain FNR-recognition sites 3 ' to the promoter . [2677602]
  • FNR is structurally related to CRP and , like CRP , binds to a 22bp sequence that accommodates two FNR subunits ( Green et al. , 1991 ; Sharrocks et aL , 1991 ) . [8748035]
  • In addition , PhlyE was characterized as a class I promoter that could be activated by the oxygenresponsive regulator FNR and/or the glucose-responsive regulator CRP ( Green and Baldwin , 1997 ; Ralph et al. , 1998 ; Westermark et al. , 2000 ) . [17892462]
  • In addition , both FNR and CRP contribute to regulation of hlyE expression ( Green and Baldwin , 1997 ; Ralph et al. , 1998 ; Westermark et al. , 2000 ) . [17892462]
  • It has been shown that relief of H-NS-mediated hlyE silencing by SlyA is much less efficient in the absence of CRP as the hlyE promoter normally needs CRP or FNR to be activated to higher levels ( Westermark et al. , 2000 ; Wyborn et al. , 2004b ) . [17892462]
  • Transcription from the main promoter , PsdhC , is thought to be activated by cAMP-CRP and was shown to be activated by reduced FNR and phosphorylated ArcA ( Park et al. 1997 ; Shen and Gunsalus 1997 ; Cunningham and Guest 1998 ) . [17273855]
  • The third feature is that yﬁD expression is enhanced during growth at acid pH. It is well known that the effects of pH on gene expression overlap with other environmental factors and particularly with oxygen availability ( Cotter et al. , 1990 ; Meng & Bennett , 1992 ; Neely et al. , 1994 ; Slonczewski & Foster , 1996 ; Blankenhorn et al. , 1999 ) and it now appears that yﬁD expression responds to both oxygen starvation and acidic pH via FNR , ArcA and an as yet unknown acid-responsive component . [11932447]
  • The available evidence therefore supports the notion that HIyX activates the expression of a latent haemolysin gene in E. coli , and that the failure of FNR to activate the expression of that gene is a consequence , in part , of subtle differences between the properties of HlyX and FNR ( Green et al. 1992 ) . [7747934]
  • The FnrN protein of R. leguminosarum is functionally similar to FixK of R. meliloti in that it activates expression of fixN , and fnrN mutants have reduced nitrogenase activity ( Colonna-Romano et al. 1990 ) However , FnrN appears to be sensitive to oxygen , indeed when expressed in E. coli , FnrN behaves rather like the FNR protein itself ( Schlfiter et al. 1992 ) . [7747934]
  • M o r e recently , studies with lac2 fusions have shown that sdh gene expression is anaerobically repressed some 70-fold by the combined effects of ArcA and FNR , a n d repressed up to threefold by glucose in a CRP - ( and FruR - ) independent manner ( Iuchi et al. , 1994 ; Park et al. , 1995 ) . [9720032]
  • Both cai and ® x operons require the presence of FNR and CRP for their expression , while they are partially repressed by H-NS ( Eichler et al. , 1995 ; Buchet et al. , 1998 ) . [10564497]
  • This is presumably due to the increased dependence of glpACB expression on FNR duringanaerobiosis ( Iuchi et al. , 1990 ) . [1372899]
  • Furthermore , the FNR homologue , Anr , activates CCP expression in Pseudomonas aeruginosa ( Zimmermann et al. , 1991 ) . [17464064]
  • We previously demonstrated that NO acts as an effector in FNR regulation of Azotobacter vinelandii gene expression ( Cruz-Ramos et al. , 2000 ; Wu et al. , 2000 ) . [12093725]
  • As a read-out , we used a ydfZ-lacZ gene fusion , the expression of which is activated by the holoform of FNR ( Kang et al. , 2005 ) . [25430730]
  • Anaerobically , the global regulator FNR ( Kiley and Beinert , 1999 ; Green et al. , 2001 ) is also involved in the regulation of hmp since an fnr mutation enhances hmp-lacZ expression ( Poole et al. , 1996 ) . [12093725]
  • As an example , the global regulator FNR , whose expression is partially under the control of RpoS , represses catabolic genes involved in carbohydrate metabolism ( Dong et al. , 2008 ; Patten et al. , 2004 ) . [23867204]
  • Expression of yﬁD is activated by FNR acting at ® 40 ± 5 , a conventional activation position , but is downregulated by a second FNR dimer at ® 93 ± 5 , which leads to maximal yﬁD expression during microaerobic-growth ( Green et al. , 1998 ; Marshall et al. , 2001 ) . [11932447]
  • The simplest explanation for this data , based on our knowledge of FNR-mediated regulation of yﬁD expression ( Green et al. , 1998 ; Green & Marshall , 1999 ; Marshall et al. , 2001 ) , is that ArcA relieves the repression mediated by the far upstream FNR dimer by competing for occupation of the ® 93 region of the yﬁD promoter . [11932447]
  • The ndh gene belongs to a small group of genes that are anaerobically repressed by FNR , others being cyo , sodA , fnr and possibly cyd ( Spiro et al. 1989 ; luchi and Lin , 1991 ; Cotter and Gunsalus , 1992 ; Hassan and Sun . [8065261]
  • Many studies have been done to examine the effect of ArcA and FNR on regulation of the electron transfer chain genes and the TCA cycle genes ( e.g. Cotter et al. , 1990 ; Iuchi et al. , 1990 ; Cotter and Gunsalus , 1992 ; Chao et al. , 1997 ; Cook et al. , 1997 ; Park et al. ,1997 ; Cunningham and Guest , 1998 ) . [16140031]
  • The relief of ArcA - and FNR-mediated repression accounts for the increased abundance of CAC and aerobic respiratory chain transcripts upon introduction of air ( Table 1 ) ( reviewed by Lynch and Lin ( 29 ) and Guest et al. ( 1 ) ) , and the temporal changes observed here are consistent with the kinetics of FNR inactivation by O2 ( 30 ) . [16857675]
  • The effect of ArcA and Fnr on the TCA cycle genes and the electron transfer chain genes under microaerobic conditions is interesting since it was previously found that ArcA and FNR regulators affect the succinate ﬂuxes as well as the redox potential ( as measured by the NADH/NAD ratio ) , under those + conditions ( Shalel-Levanon et al. , 2005a ) . [16140031]
  • The cyd and cyo operons encoding the quinol oxidases Cyo and Cyd which operate under aerobic or microaerobic conditions are subject to O2 regulation by ArcA and FNR ( Tseng et al. , 1996 ; Fu et al. 1991 ) . [11931557]
  • In the presence of oxygen , the iron -- sulphur clusters disassemble , leading to the formation of FNR monomers and subsequent inhibition of DNA binding , thereby switching off FNR-activated genes ( Crack et al. , 2004 , 2006 ; Kiley & Beinert , 2003 ; Lazazzera et al. , 1996 ; Sutton et al. , 2004a , b ) . [17464064]
  • In Alcaligenes species , Paracoccus denitrificans , Vitreoscilla , and Azorhizobium , the presence of FNR homologs has also been suggested ( Nees et al. 1988 ; Hoitink et al. 1990 ; Spiro 1992 ; Hoeren et al. 1993 ; Nishiyama et al. 1993 ; Cramm et al. 1994 ; Joshi and Dikshit 1994 ) . [8588737]
  • FNR DA154 , a constitutively active mutant of FNR that dimerizes stably in the presence of oxygen ( 48 ) , was puriﬁed as a His6-tagged protein from strain M15 by a new method described by Wing et al. ( H. Wing , J. Green , J. Guest , and S. Busby , submitted for publication ) . [10894724]
  • Green et al. ( 9 ) reported that the wild-type FNR protein , purified in the presence of 0.1 mM Fe2 + salts , contained 1.1 mol of Fe per mol of FNR monomer . [8577745]
  • Genetic and biochemical analyses of FNR suggest that the Fe is bound in a tetrahedral conformation by four cysteine residues ( Trageser and Unden 1989 ; Melville and Gunsalus 1990 ; Sharrocks et al. 1990 ; Unden et al. 1990 ; Six et al. 1995 ) , similar to the situation in rubredoxin ( Jensen 1974 ) . [8588737]
  • However , only mutations in Cys122 , but not in Cys20 , Cys23 , and Cys129 strongly decreased the Fe-content in isolated FNR , indicating that Cys122 is of special importance for Fe binding ( Green et al. 1993 ; Six et al. 1995 ) . [8588737]
  • Of the five cysteine residues in FNR , Cys-122 appears to be the most important in that it is absolutely required for disulphide bond formation , iron binding and covalent modification ( Green et al. 1993 ) . [7747934]
  • FNR-D154A-AR mutants do not impair DNA binding When FNR-AR mutants were initially isolated , in vivo FNR-dependent repression of Pndh was used as a reporter for FNR ± DNA binding ( Williams et al. , 1991 ; Bell and Busby , 1994 ) . [11115116]
  • The cofactors of FNR essential for specific binding to DNA were not studied so far in vitro , since isolated FNR does not bind sequence specific to DNA ( Green et al. 1991 ) . [1854188]
  • The increase in absorbance at 330 nm is frequently seen during the degradation ( and acquisition ) of the iron -- sulphur clusters of FNR and related proteins , e.g. the FNR of Azotobacter vinelandii ( Wu et al. , 2000 ) , but the reason is not known . [11101674]

  • The iron was bound very loosely and the amount of bound iron was inversely related to the amount of cysteines ( max 4/mol FNR ) reacting with DTNB ( Green et al. 1991 ) . [1854188]
  • The requirements for Lrp and IHF ( especially in the absence of FNR ) are consistent with their greater abundance in slow-growing or stationary-phase organisms ( Landgraf et al. , 1996 ; Goosen & van de Putte , 1995 ) . [11101674]
  • The results of these experiments also challenged claims that FNR can function as a physiologically relevant sensor of NO ( Cruz-Ramos et al. , 2002 ; Corker & Roole , 2003 ; Pullan et al. , 2007 ) . [22092912]
  • The putative cAMP-CRP binding sequence resembles that of canonical FNR ( Scott et al. , 1995 ) , but it appears that FNR is not involved in the regulation of gntK expression , because the gluconate Transcriptional attenuation within the beginning of gntU The CAT activity from pGNTKU-CAT7 also depended on cAMP , like pGNTK-CAT1 but it was three to sixfold lower under all conditions tested ( Table 3 ) . [9135111]
  • The presence of potential FNR-binding sites suggests that aconitase may be negatively regulated by both FNR and ArcA , like cytochrome o oxidase ( Iuchi , et al. , 1990 ; Cotter et al. , 1990 ) . [1541275]
  • The consensus sequence for FNR binding is very similar to that for CRP , differing at just two symmetrically related positions in the inverted repeat ; appropriate changes at these positions can result in interconversion of CRP and FNR sites ( Bell et aL , 1989 ; Zhang and Ebright , 1990 ; Jennings and Beacham , 1993 ) . [8748035]
  • Recent works suggest that such negative regulation is indirect and involves trans-regu-lators such as FliA or FNR or diguanylate cyclases tha produce the signal molecule c di-GMP ( Dong et al. , 2008 ; Patten et al. , 2004 ; Pesavento et al. , 2008 ) . [23867204]
  • Keywords : CRP -- FNR protein superfamily , iron -- sulphur proteins , transcriptional regulation , nitrogen starvation , stationary phase INTRODUCTION The CRP -- FNR family of transcription regulators contains at least 70 members that respond to a variety of metabolic and environmental signals to control a diverse range of physiological functions in an equally diverse range of bacteria ( Spiro , 1994 ; Guest et al. , 1996 ; Vollack et al. , 1999 ) . [11101674]
  • These include the transcription factor FNR that mediates anaerobic regulation ( Unden and Schirawski , 1997 ) , the cAMP receptor protein ( CRP ) , which activates transcription of catabolic operons ( Kolb et al. , 1993 ) , and the nucleoid-associated protein H-NS ( Atlung and Ingmer , 1997 ) . [10564497]
  • The FNR protein primarily coordinates gene regulation in remodelling central metabolism in response to changes in oxygen availability in many bacteria ( Guest et al. , 1996 ; Korner et al. , 2003 ) , but it also exerts effects over other systems , and new members of the FNR regulon are still being uncovered ( Covert et al. , 2004 ; Kang et al. , 2005 ) . [17464064]
  • IHF is also a positive effector of 070 promoters , some of which , for example hemA , narGHJZ , narK , pfl and sodA , are regulated in response to oxygen by FNR ( Guest et al. , 1996 ) . [9308170]
  • Furthermore , the ACS enzyme is positively regulated by CRP ( generating acetyl-CoA ) , high levels of AMP , and FNR ( at low oxygen partial pressure ) , whereas it is negatively regulated by the j2 factor ( Kumari et al. , 2000 ) . [14595781]
  • Control of signal transmission to the ArcA transcription factor is complex ( Alexeeva et al. , 2000 ; Kwon et al. , 2000 ; Matsubara and Mizuno , 2000 ) , and it is clear that the Arc system and FNR represent two quite different means of monitoring the presence of oxygen . [11251844]
  • These experiments are in agreement with the observations of Jordan et al. [ 30 ] , who could not detect signi cents cant amounts of ferric iron by EPR when FNR was oxidized by oxygen . [9990723]
  • β-galactosidase values were expressed as fold repression for the level of IscR activity , and as fold activation for the level of FNR activity . [25430730]
  • The FNR transcriptional-activator activity was expressed in fold activation by dividing the β-galactosidase activity measured for each strain by the β-galactosidase activity present in the strain lacking FNR ( PK8203 ) . [25430730, 25430730, 25430730]
  • The changes in ndb-lacZexpression further suggest that a regulatorynetwork is operatingat the ndhpromoter , in which Arr ( amino acid specific activation ) and Nbp ( growth-phase-dependent repression ) may serve to modulate the repression mediated by the primary regulator , FNR . [8809757]
  • The current microarray data confirmed 32 of these 43 assignments , but alone did not confirm FNR activation of five operons ( adhE , glpTQ , cydDC , hlyE and arcA ) or FNR repression of six operons ( hemA , narXL , tpx , yeiL , norVW and ubiCA ) . [16417494]
  • Note , however , that these microarray data alone did not confirm FNR activation of five of these operons ( adhE , glpTQ , cydDC , hlyE , and arcA ; Table 2 , part B ) or FNR repression of the seven operons listed in Table 2 , part D. [16377617]
  • Although synthesis of FNR protein is indeed subject to catabolite repression ( 39 ) , fnr ' - ` lacZ fusions contained in crp and cya mutant cells can still express 60 % of the B-galactosidase activity measured in the wild-type strain ( 30 ) . [2407723]
  • In strains containing lacZ fused to Pndh , inactivation of FNR should lead to a rapid loss of Pndh repression and a corresponding increase in - galactosidase activity per milliliter of culture , reﬂecting a new rate of synthesis ; since - galactosidase is a stable protein , the rate of its accumulation should reﬂect the rate of - galactosidase synthesis . [15547274]
  • In contrast , repression of Pfnr was approximately ﬁve - to sixfold less efﬁcient in strains expressing the FNR-CA23 and FNR-CA122 mutants than Pfnr repression by plasmid-derived wild-type FNR . [17293415]
  • For example , repression of Pfnr was increased approximately fourfold in vivo when FNR was expressed from a multicopy plasmid and was larger ( approximately ﬁvefold ) in vitro than in vivo ( approximately twofold ) when FNR was expressed from the chromosome . [17293415]
  • However , a study of the NarL regulon based on transcriptome ana-lysis [ 11 ] identiﬁed some genes that appeared to be activated by NarL without FNR , and a thorough genetic analysis of the yeaR-yoaG operon regulatory region by Valley Stewart and co-workers proved that NarL activates the yeaR promoter independently of FNR [ 12 ] . [19245365]
  • Regulatory pattern III ( anaerobically repressed , but not affected by ArcA ) and pattern IV ( anaerobically activated , but not affected by ArcA ) are most easily explained as genes controlled by the FNR protein or by an as yet unidentified global regulator such as Lrp , IHF , FIS , or H-NS . [15699038]
  • As at the nrf promoter , the nir promoter can be activated by FNR alone but FNR-dependent activation is repressed by IHF and Fis ( Wu et al. , 1998 ; Browning et al. , 2000 ) . [15978080]
  • Another example is the promoter of the nrfA operon that is activated by FNR and repressed by Fis and IHF . [17233826]
  • These data clearly indicate that the hcp promoter is activated by FNR and repressed by NsrR . [17449618]
  • Consequently , protection against damage by NO must also be activated by NarL , FNR or both . [22029434]
  • Only five operons were induced by nitrate , NarXL and NarP , two of which were also activated by FNR . [16377617]
  • Nitrate-stimulated NarP activated expression of 14 operons ; all of those most strongly activated by NarP were part of the FNR regulon and had been characterized independ-ently . [16377617]
  • Recent genomic studies of the FNR and NarL regulons revealed that ynfEFGHI expression is also activated by FNR and repressed by NarL ( 4 , 8 ) , but the different promoter elements were not deﬁned experimentally . [19251855]
  • These results suggest that we might expect the total number of genes directly activated or repressed by FNR to be in the range of 200 genes . [12754220]
  • Consistent with the inactivation of FNR by NO ( 34 ) , it was generally observed that FNR-repressed genes ( ndh , hmpA , gpmA , and lpdA ) were induced , whereas FNR-activated genes were repressed ( narG , pyrD , yjiH , aroP , and rmuC ) . [15546870]
  • The combined data , summarized in Fig. 2 , have established that at least 103 operons are regulated by FNR , 68 of which are activated by FNR and 35 are repressed . [16377617]
  • On this basis , we predict that relatively few operons that are strongly activated or repressed by FNR were not detected in the current experiments , and the biochemical relevance of any small effects of FNR missed in the current experiments is likely to be minimal . [16377617]
  • Forty four operons not previously known to be included in the FNR regulon were activated by FNR , and a further 28 operons appeared to be repressed . [16377617]

  • Identiﬁcation and Characterization of a Two-Component Sensor-Kinase and Response-Regulator System ( DcuS-DcuR ) Controlling Gene Expression in Response to C4-Dicarboxylates in Escherichia coli PAUL GOLBY ,1 SUZANNE DAVIES ,2 DAVID J. KELLY ,2 JOHN R. GUEST ,2 AND SIMON C. ANDREWS1 * The School of Animal and Microbial Sciences , University of Reading , Whiteknights , Reading RG6 6AJ ,1 and The Krebs Institute for Biomolecular Research , Department of Molecular Biology and Biotechnology , University of Shefﬁeld , Western Bank , Shefﬁeld S10 2TN ,2 United Kingdom Received 30 September 1998/Accepted 8 December 1998 The dcuB gene of Escherichia coli encodes an anaerobic C4-dicarboxylate transporter that is induced anaerobically by FNR , activated by the cyclic AMP receptor protein , and repressed in the presence of nitrate by NarL . [9973351]
  • The dcuB gene is strongly activated anaerobically by FNR , repressed in the presence of nitrate by NarL , and subject to cyclic AMP receptor protein ( CRP ) - mediated catabolite repression . [9852003]
  • The frd ( Con ) mutants such as ECL511 synthesize fumarate reductase aerobically and no longer respond to FNR or nitrate repression mediatedvia NarL , whereas frd ( 0xr ) mutants , ECL515 and 516 , are partially derepressed aerobically , strongly induced by anaerobiosis but still subject to the nitrate effect . [2677602]
  • The GA85 substitution suppresses nitrite-dependent stimulation of pnrf , suggesting again that nitrite-triggered NarL or NarP Interacts in some way with FNR , and that this interaction can be disrupted by an alteration in FNR . [7854119]
  • However , the effects , if any , of FNR , nitrate , nitrite , NarXL , and NarP on torCAD and frdABCD transcription , and also the responses of the large majority of operons known to be subject to FNR control , were entirely consistent with previous data from other studies , so we conclude that this was not a problem . [16377617]
  • Integration of three signals at the Escherichia coli nrf ole f Summary Expression from the Escherichia coli nrf operon promoter is activated by the anaerobically triggered transcription factor , FNR , and by the nitrate/nitrite ioncontrolled response-regulators , NarL or NarP , but is repressed by the IHF and Fis proteins . [15978080]
  • These problems are especially acute for studies of global regulators such as FNR at promoters where FNR regulation is co-de-pendent upon another factor , for example NarL or NarP . [16377617]
  • FNR , NarL and NarP regulation of # rd / # rd-red transcription 3.6 . [12586421]
  • the transcription activator FNR ( fumarate-nitrate regulation ) in response to anaerobiosis , and by transcription regulators NarL and NarP in response to nitrite and nitrate . [15667305]
  • NarL and NarP activate FNR-dependent transcription by counteracting the repressive effects of IHF and Fis ( Fig. 1B ) , and thus the role of IHF and Fis is to set the co-dependence of pnir on both FNR and NarL/NarP . [15225315]
  • Thus , our measurements reﬂect the ability of FNR to activate pnir without the aid of NarL or NarP . [18757534]
  • Operons in this group include frdA and dmsA , both of which are known to be subject to hierarchical control by FNR and NarL in response to oxygen and nitrate ( 32 , 33 ) . [16377617]
  • Appropriately , both are anaerobically induced by FNR and repressed by NarL in response to nitrate ( 14 , 17 ) , thus ensuring that oxygen and nitrate are utilized in preference to fumarate as terminal electron acceptors . [9852003]
  • This result shows that NarL is ` active ' in the absence of extracellular nitrate or nitrite and suggests that FNR needs a ` helper ' when in the context of the nirB promoter . [8437517]
  • results conﬁrm that the ogt promoter is induced by NarL in response to nitrate ions , without help from FNR . [19245365]
  • Transcription initiation at the nrfA promoter is activated by FNR in the absence of oxygen and induced further by NarL and NarP in response to low concentrations of nitrate or to nitrite ( 35 , 44 ) . [17449618]
  • Transcription of a further group of genes , including yeaR , yoaG , yibH , and yibI encoding proteins of unknown function , is partially FNR-dependent and strongly induced by nitrate but also strongly induced by nitrite in an FNR mutant , suggesting that multiple regulatory circuits regulate the response of these genes to nitrate and nitrite . [16377617]
  • The YtfE protein was recently implicated in the NO stress response [ 14 ] : in parallel with hmpA , ytfE transcription is strongly induced by nitrate , repressed by FNR and optimally expressed in an fnr mutant during growth in the presence of nitrite ( Table 1 ) . [16417494]
  • Conversely , transcription of both the nap and nrf operons is totally dependent on FNR , repressed by nitrate but induced by nitrite , effectively providing protection against NO generated in the anaerobic gastrointestinal tract where nitrate is a scarce but valuable electron acceptor . [16417494]
  • All of the seven operons that were both previously reported and confirmed in the current experiments to be repressed by FNR were induced by nitrate in the fnr mutant . [16377617]
  • Transcription from the hmp and ytfE promoters appeared to be repressed by FNR but strongly induced by both nitrate and nitrite . [16377617]

Constantinidou School of Biosciences , University of Birmingham , Birmingham B15 2TT , U.K. Abstract RNA was isolated from cultures of Escherichia coli strain MG1655 and derivatives defective in fnr , narXL , or narXL with narP , during aerobic-growth , or anaerobic-growth in the presence or absence of nitrate or nitrite , in non-repressing media in which both strain MG1655 and an fnr deletion mutant grew at similar rates . [16417494]

  • In our recent microarray study of the FNR , NarL , and NarP regulons of E. coli , members of the NsrR regulon were up-regulated in cultures growing anaerobically in the presence of nitrate and nitrite , presumably as a consequence of NO formation . [17449618]
  • DISCUSSION Induction of the E. coli nir operon is codependent on two environmental stimuli , the absence of oxygen and the presence of nitrate or nitrite ions , and these stimuli are signaled by FNR and NarL or NarP , respectively ( 25 ) . [18757534]
  • To examinewhether the nitrate block , like oxygen repression , could be lifted by increased amounts of FNR a slot blot analysis was performed on mRNA samples extracted from organisms grown anaerobically in the presence of nitrate . [2677602]
  • Mutation of the 242 heptamer ( overlapping the FNR site ) impaired repression in the presence of nitrate , but not nitrite ( Table 4 ) , despite the absence of clear protection of the 242 heptamer by phospho-NarL in the footprinting assay . [18227264]

[8000525]

[12754220]

[9852003]

[15547274]

  • Furthermore , the FNR-independent aerobic increase in YﬁD protein content at low pH correlated with enhanced expression of yﬁD : : lac in these cultures ( 110 Miller U for cultures without added benzoate , compared to 460 Miller U for those with benzoate ) , suggesting that although FNR may contribute to increasing yﬁD expression during growth under acidic conditions it is not essential for acid induction of yﬁD expression and that another factor is mediating this effect . [11932447]
  • In the absence of the FNR protein , the aerobic exponential expression of nrdD was slightly reduced ( Table 2 ) and the stationary-phase induction was virtually absent , indicating that the induction during the deceleration phase of growth is caused by oxygen limitation . [12923108]
