[18757534]
  • NarL , wiiicin was initiaily discovered as a transcription factor essentiai for the activation of nitrate reductase expression by nitrate ( Stewart , 1982 ) , Recent studies of the nitrate reductase promoter have identified the FNR - and NarLbinding sites around 41 and 200 bp upstream of the transcription start , respectiveiy ( Li and DeMoss , 1988 ; Walker andDeMoss , 1991 ; Dong ef a / . [8437517]
  • Analysis of the DNA upstream of the yﬁD coding region revealed an unusual architecture for an FNR-activated promoter ( Fig. 1 ) with two FNR sites positioned at ¹ 61.5 and ¹ 114.5 relative to the transcription start for HlyXmediated expression ( Green and Baldwin , 1997a ) . [9767578]
  • Transcript mapping using RNA isolated from HlyX-expressing stationary-phase cultures indicated that the FNR sites were 61.5 ( FNR I ) and 114.5 ( FNR II ) bp upstream of the transcript start ( Green and Baldwin , 1997a ) . [9767578]
  • In two denitrifying Pseudomonas species , P. stutzeri and P. aeruginosa , expression of the nir , nor , and nos genes is regulated by the NO-responsive FNR-like transcriptional activator DNR that binds to a DNA motif similar to the consensus FNR box , TTGATnnnnATCAA [ 34,35 ] . [16261196]
  • In other cases the evidence is at present only indirect , and involves the identification of DNA sequences potentially recognised by FNR ( subsequently referred to as FNR boxes ) , observations on the behaviour of heterologous promoters that are consistent with the presence of an FNR homologue , or hybridisation to thefnr homologue of another organism ( Table 2 ) . [7747934]
  • e.g. for FNR at position 11 a T which is found five times in a sample of 14 G 6 2 4 1 3 2 3 2 5 3 2 - 7 2 1 6 4 1 2 1 5 2 3 2 2 1 4 1 1 6 7 6 7 5 5 6 - - 1 6 2 - - 1 1 6 9 9 4 7 7 6 3 7 7 3 6 7 7 4 9 9 6 1 1 - - 2 1 6 - - 6 5 5 7 6 7 6 1 1 4 1 2 2 1 2 5 1 2 1 4 1 6 2 7 - 2 3 5 2 3 2 3 1 4 2 6 A T C cons T A T T T A T T T T C A G T G A A A A T A A A T A G K K K C A C T G T T T C Discussion The aim of the present study was to show that FNR actually stimulates transcription , to characterize a group of FNR-dependent promoters , and to detect sequences likely to correspond to FNR bindingsites . [2677602]
  • The major effect of mutation on anaerobic induction of promoters 6 and 7 is consistent with the existence of putative FNR recognition sequences directly upstream of these promoters ( 21 ) . [1592804]
  • To confirm that these two promoters direct transcription and to examine whether these putative FNR-binding sites are required to mediate FNR-dependent anaerobic induction of pfl operon expression , base pair substitutions were introduced with the aim of destroying the recognition capacities of these respective sequences for RNA polymerase or FNR . [7934836]
  • The FNR protein probably binds to at least two related DNA sequences in the regulatory region of the pfl operon , is both of which are proximal to promoters ( Fig. 1A ) . [8376324]
  • Thus it is envisaged that in response to anoxia , FNR is transformed by a conformational change into a transcriptional activator or repressor , which recognizes and binds to specific DNA sequences in the promoters of its target genes . [1957353]
  • Under anaerobic conditions FNR is a dimeric iron-sulfur protein that binds at specific DNA sequences to activate the expression of `` anaerobic genes '' and to repress the expression of `` aerobic genes '' ( 7 , 8 , 13 ) . [21252224]
  • FNR binds to ∼ 25 bp sequences at target promoters and recruits RNA polymerase , thereby activating transcription . [20533909]
  • Hence , in anaerobic conditions , FNR is able to bind to speciﬁc DNA targets at promoters and modulate transcription . [17164287]
  • y Binding n-Regulation of the Escherichia coli K-12 nrf Promoter b of the NsrR Nitric Oxide-Sensing Transcription Repressor to an Upstream Site Douglas F. Browning ,1 * David J. Lee ,1 Stephen Spiro ,2 and Stephen J. W. Busby1 School of Biosciences , University of Birmingham , Birmingham B15 2TT , United Kingdom ,1 and Department of Molecular and Cell Biology , The University of Texas at Dallas , Richardson , Texas 750802 ow D Received 1 March 2010/Accepted 9 May 2010 FNR-dependent activation of the Escherichia coli K-12 nrf promoter is downregulated by the nitric oxide-sensitive NsrR protein together with the nucleoid-associated protein IHF , which bind to overlapping targets adjacent to the DNA site for FNR . [20472787]
  • DNA Binding of FNR152 to a Synthetic Consensus FNR Recognition Site . [8577745]
  • Consensus FNR A A A * T T G A T **** A T C A A * T T T feo AACCTTGAGCCACA T C A A CATT FIG. 5 . [8407793]
  • A previous study to identify new members of the FNR regulon by searching the E. coli K-12 genome sequence for sites similar to this consensus using the search pattern tool in the Colibri database ( http : / genolist.Pasteur.fr / Colibri ) identified yfgF as a potential target ( Partridge et al. , 2007a ) . [20522491]
  • The E. coli K-12 genome sequence was searched for the presence of consensus FNR sites ( TTGATnnnnATCAA ) using the search pattern tool in the Colibri database ( http : / / genolist.Pasteur.fr / Colibri ) . [17464064]
  • Studies with t w o rnutant frd prornoters frorn Escherichia coli , displaying altered regulation and FNR response , provided additional evidence for recognition of this sequence by FNR . [2677602]
  • Consensus sequences to which the FNR protein may bind have been proposed on the basis of sequence homology in the 5 ' - noncoding regions of FNR-dependent genes ( 18 , 22 , 39 ) . [2407723]
  • To explain the repressive effect on narX transcription by FNR as disclosed in the present study , another consensus sequence between + lOl and + ll4 ( box ( l ) of ~ ~ r ~ inTable 1 ) isproposed to be essential as an additional anaero-box in the overlapping narX/K promoter . [8119409]
  • The FNR homolog in S. Typhimurium , oxaR , has a similar but less defined consensus sequence [ 60 ] , which could account for the lack of association with stm57 motif # 1 . [22144874]
  • The recognition sequence for FNR exhibits twofold symmetry ( Spiro and Guest . [7934836, 7934836]
  • The fourth column includes sequence logos for presumably homogeneous and large site sets and sequence consensi for small sets of DNA sites and for well-established motifs of other factors ( FNR , CRP , CooA , NtcA , ArcR ) . [16261196]
  • The consensus sequence for FNR is similar to that for CRP consensus , and previous studies have shown that FNR activates transcription initiation in a similar way to CRP and that both proteins can bind to the DNA site for the other protein ( 41,42 ) . [15520470]
  • The DNA sequences of the mutated FNR site and Nar heptamers are shown below the main sequence . [18227264]
  • The DNA sequences protected by ArcA-P or FNR * - DA154 from DNase I hydrolysis and also containing the consensus sequence for the two proteins are bracketed . [11357510]
  • The conservation of sequences within the DNA-binding domains and FNR boxes from non-enteric bacteria lends support to the idea that there is a conservation of the mechanism of DNA sequence recognition . [7747934]
  • The sizes of the DNA footprints are consistent with the binding of two monomers of FNR that protect the symmetrical FNR-recognition sequence TTGAT-nnnnATCAA . [8577745]
  • The palindromic nature of the DNA recognition sequence dictates that FNR binds as a dimer ( Green ef a / . [7934836]
  • The tentative conclusion is that the FNR homologues recognise the same , or a very similar DNA sequence . [7747934]
  • ( C ) The figure shows a DNA sequence motif present at newly identified FNR targets . [17164287]
  • See M methods section for details oter DNA in aterials and FNR binding to moe operator/promoter DNA Although FNR behaves as a repressor of moeA-lacZ expression in vivo , an FNR-binding consensus sequence ( TTGAT-N4-ATCAA ; Spiro and Guest 1990 ) is not detectable in the DNA upstream of the moe operon . [11357510]
  • Both proteins apparently recognize the same DNA sequence as FNR but the physiological signal to which they respond is not known . [1957353]
  • FNR protein is a homodimer that contains symmetrical he-lix-turn-helix structures that interact with a highly conserved , dyad consensus DNA sequence ( 5 ) . [12754220]
  • A putative FNR consensus sequence ( 44 ) in the hyf upstream DNA can be detected between positions 111 and 98 ( Fig. 2 ) . [14702328]
  • The FNR * - DA154 protein , at a concentration less than 0.5 µM , protected a region of DNA upstream of moe that included the TTCAT sequence in the moe operator DNA ( Fig. 5 ) . [11357510]
  • It is possible that FNR binds to the sequence TTCAT in the moe operator DNA to facilitate repression . [11357510]
  • If the moe operator DNA has the full FNR consensus sequence in the operator region , the moe operon would be effectively repressed under conditions of the highest demand for Mocofactor . [11357510]
  • Our ﬁndings suggest that FNR and CRP bind to the same sequence in the clyA promoter . [11053378]
  • Since modification of the putative FNR boxes affected FNR binding to the nrdD promoter sequence , we examined whether such modifications also altered in vivo transcription . [18683632]
  • FNR is an iron-dependent , DNA-binding protein which recognizes a specific sequence motif found in the promoter regions of the genes it regulates . [1592804]
  • Transfer of the target sequence for FNR to a CRP - dependent promoter Recent studies by Guest and coworkers have clearly shown that the DNA binding domains of the FNR protein and CRP are homologous and , therefore , likely to recognize similar sites ( Shaw et at . [2845227]
  • Nevertheless , such cross-talk is likely to be limited because FNR can not recognize a CRP-site consensus sequence in vitro ( Green et al. , 1996b ; Sawers et al. , 1997 ) and the affinity of CRP for a FNR-site consensus is 50-fold lower than for its natural binding site ( Sawers et al. , 1997 ) . [11407111]

  • In previous work ( 3 -- 6 ) , we showed that the DNA target for FNR at pnrf is centered at position 41.5 ( i.e. , between 41 and 42 bp upstream from the transcript start point ) , that anaerobically induced FNR-dependent activation of pnrf is downregulated by the binding of the nucleoid-associated protein IHF to a target ( IHF I ) centered at position 54 , and that this repression is relieved by the binding of either NarL or NarP to a DNA target centered at position 74.5 ( Fig. 1 ) . [20472787]
  • Results in Fig. 2 show that FNR and NarL each protect 30 bp , consistent with binding of a dimer of each protein to a single target . [19251855]
  • As expected , when NarL or FNR was incubated with the pnir7150 fragment , single shifted complexes were detected ( Fig. 6A , lanes 1 -- 4 and 5 -- 7 ) , conﬁrming that each protein binds to a single site . [15225315]
  • Using mutational analysis and gel retardation assays , we showed that IHF binds to a site centred at position -54 , overlapping the DNA sites for FNR and NarL/NarP , while Fis binds to a site at position -15 , overlapping the promoter -10 element ( Fig. 1 ) . [15978080]
  • This results from its dependence on FNR that binds to a site at position -41.5 , and NarL or NarP that bind to a 7-2-7 element centred at position -69.5 ( Fig. 10 ; Jayaraman et al. , 1989 ; Tyson et al. , 1993 ) . [15978080]

[2677602]

  • These observations suggest that the TTGAT sequences are the sites of FNR action and that FNR binding at the downstream half-site ( Fig. 1 ) is the primary interaction . [14612240]

  • More is known about the interaction of FNR with DNA.Comparisons between FNR-regulated promoters revealed a binding-site consensus sequence , which was later confirmed by a variety of in vivo studies 6 and in vitro footprinting ~ 2 . [1957353]
  • As the pO2 decreases ( microaerophilia ) , the amount of FNR able to bind DNA increases proportionally , yielding amounts of active FNR in the cell that are sufficient to allow binding to the high-affinity FNR-2 site ( which also displays greater similarity to the FNR consensus sequence ) , but not to the FNR-1 site . [18683632]
  • Furthermore , a sequence with similarity to the consensus binding site for the anaerobic fumarate and nitrate reduction response regulator ( known as FNR ) , ` TTGAT-N4-ATCAA ' [ 38 ] , is encountered centred about 105 bp upstream the start codon . [10651802]
  • Of the 46 genes down-regulated in the presence of FNR ( patterns I , V , and VI , Figs. 4 and 5 ) , 20 contain a documented or predicted FNR-binding site at or near the transcriptional start site with less than a 2-bp mismatch to the 10-bp FNR consensus sequence . [12754220]
  • None of these genes possess a documented FNR-binding site or any site with less than a 2-bp mismatch to the 10-bp FNR consensus sequence . [12754220]
  • Sequences were selected on the basis of their similarity to the core of the E. coli FNR binding site consensus ( TI'GAT -- ATCAA ) , and if there is good reason to believe that the promoter concerned might be regulated by an FNR homologue . [7747934]

[9308170]
  • Consistent with the hypothesis that YdhY -- T has a role in anaerobic metabolism , gel retardation , footprinting , sitedirected mutagenesis and transcript-mapping experiments showed that the oxygen-responsive transcription factor FNR directly activates transcription of ydhY -- T under anaerobic conditions by binding at a site located at position 242.5 relative to the transcript start , confirming and extending earlier work that shows that ydhY is expressed from a class II FNR-dependent promoter ( Kang et al. , 2005 ) . [18227264]

  • Spacing requirements To determine whether the spacing of the tandem FNR sites is critical for FNR-mediated downregulation of class II FNR-dependent transcription activation , PyfiD variants in which the upstream FNR site was moved closer to , or farther from , the fixed class II site at 240.5 were constructed . [11169114]

  • The FNR protein induces expression anaerobically , and evidence indicates that it probably binds to a specific recognition sequence located around position -40 bp relative to the transcription initiation site ( 41 ) . [8376324]
  • Transcription from the nrf promoter was totally dependent upon the FNR protein which , at other promoters , binds to an inverted-repeat sequence centred about 41 bases upstream of the transcription initiation site ( Jayaraman et ai , 1989 ) . [7934939]
  • Under anaerobic conditions , FNR binds to a site centred between positions 241 and 242 , activating transcription of the nir operon . [10972841]
  • At most target promoters , FNR binds to a site centered near position 41.5 and activates transcription by interacting directly with the RNAP and subunits . [19251855]
  • At pnir , FNR binds to a DNA site centered at position 41.5 and activates transcription directly by interacting with RNA polymerase ( 25 ) ( Fig. 1A ) . [18757534]
  • This expression depends on transcription activation by FNR ( fumarate and nitrate reduction regulator ) , which binds to a target centred at position − 72.5 upstream of the transcript start site . [20533909]
  • FNR binds to a single DNA target centred at position -41.5 ( i.e. between base pairs -41 and -42 upstream from the transcription start ) and promoter activity is completely dependent on FNR bound at this site ( Tyson et al. , 1994 ) . [15978080]
  • At most target promoters , FNR binds as a dimer to a DNA site centred near position -41 , upstream of the transcription start point . [15225315]
  • Galimand et al. ( 1991 ) have drawn attention to a number of other FNR boxes upstream of P. aeruginosa genes , including one around the transcription start site of the plcS gene encoding phospholipase C . [7747934]

  • Summary Previous work with semi-synthetic promoters containing a single CRP binding site centred at 41.5 bp from the transcription start site has demonstrated enhanced transcription ( synergism ) when a second binding site , for CRP or FNR , is placed upstream at around -91 bp . [8748035]
  • This event would , conceivably , position the upstream NarL-binding site and bound NarL protein close to the FNR and RNA polymerase proteins to provide the necessary conditions for narK transcription . [1429433]
  • The ansB promoter in Escherichia coil is co-activated in a co-dependent manner by one dimer each of CRP and FNR protein whose binding sites are at around -91 and -41 bp , respectively , from the transcription start site . [8748035]

  • RESULTS FNR binds at a site located 42.5 bp upstream of the ydhY transcript start Earlier studies have shown that ydhY expression is FNR-dependent in vivo and in vitro , and that the size of the in vitro transcription product is consistent with the presence of an FNR-dependent class II promoter ( Kang et al. 2005 ) , but the precise transcript start site has not been mapped . [18227264]
  • Transcription from the narGHJI promoter ( narGp ) under anaerobic conditions depends on the activation of FNR ( 14 ) , which binds to sequences just upstream ( 242 bp ) from the transcription start site ( 18 ) . [8682807]
  • One promoter ( PydjX ) contained an FNR site at a class I spacing ( 60.5 bp upstream of the transcription start site ) , making this the ﬁrst naturally occurring class I FNR-dependent promoter characterized by in vitro transcription assays . [15659690]
  • It is shown that the yhjA gene of E. coli possesses a class II FNR site and an OxyR site upstream of the yhjA transcript start . [17464064]
  • When FNR acts as an activator of gene expression , it most often binds to a site ( s ) upstream of and including a site centered at an average distance of 41.5 bp before the transcriptional start site of the affected gene or operon . [12754220]
  • However , the more common architecture for FNR-activated promoters is that adopted by class II promoters , which have an FNR site centred at or close to 41.5 bp upstream of the transcript start site . [18227264]
  • Three promoters ( PynfE , PydhY , and PydfZ ) had a putative FNR site centered at 41.5 bp upstream of the transcription start site , a position typical of previously characterized FNR class II promoters ( 49 ) . [15659690]
  • A well-predicted FNR site and a moderately predicted CRP site are centered at bp 103.5 ( 45.5 ) and bp 43.5 2 bp ( 2106.5 ) , respectively ( Fig. 8B ) . [9852003]
  • FNR directly binds to the predicted downstream site but not the upstream site in vitro . [17293415]
  • PyfiDD begins at 261 and therefore lacks the upstream FNR site . [11169114]
  • In cydD-P the site ( 5 - TTGATN4AaCgc-3 , where lowercase letters are used to indicate bases that do not match the FNR site consensus ) is centered 123 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site ( Fig. 5B ) . [20075074]
  • For example , FNR did not bind to the predicted upstream site , which contains 7 out of 10 bp that match the consensus site . [17293415]
  • ScanAce revealed putative FNR sites for cfa , hdeA , slp , ompC , wrbA , yccD , yliI , and yhiD , suggesting that FNR may act directly at these promoters . [15659690]
  • It is well established that narK and narGHJI are organized as two operons transcribed in the same orientation , but with 500 bp of intergenic DNA that includes a rho-independent narK transcription terminator , and binding sites for regulation by the oxygen-responsive transcription factor , FNR , and the nitrate -- nitrite-responsive two-component regulatory system , NarX -- NarL ( Stewart & Parales , 1988 ; Kolesnikow et al. , 1992 ) . [16804183]
  • NarP ( Darwin and Stewart , 1995 ) , FNR ( Darwin et al. , 1998 ) and ModE ( McNicholas and Gunsalus , 2002 ) binding sites are over - or underlined . [16677314]
  • FNR * binding to nrdDG was assessed by a gel retardation assay , as described by Lazazzera et al. [ 15 ] . [18683632]
  • Class I promoters possess FNR sites located close to 261.5 , 271.5 , 282.5 or 292.5 ( Wing et al. , 1995 ) . [18227264]
  • Competition has been reported between IHF bound at IHF I and both RNAP and FNR for their overlapping sites , and between IHF bound at IHF II and NarL/P for their overlapping sites ( Browning et al. , 2002 ; 2005 ) . [17630973]
  • Similar explanations apply to the six operons that we failed to confirm to be FNR-repressed ; no credible FNR sites are located in the hemA or norVW promoters ( the latter is an RpoN-dependent promoter ) , and putative sites in the ubiCA , yeiL , and tpx promoters diverge from the consensus . [16377617]
  • Here we report a deletion analysis of nirB promoter sequences designed to locate the sites for transcription activation by the FNR protein and nitrite . [2845227]
  • Predicted FNR and cyclic AMP receptor protein ( CRP ) sites at suitable distances from putative promoter sequences are located immediately upstream of aspA and dcuB ( 36 , 44 ) . [9852003]
  • It is interesting to note that the FNR proteins of Bacillus subtilis and Bacillus lichenformis are predicted to recognize CRP sites on the basis of the amino acid sequence . [11407111]
  • Thus FNR could be converted such as to bind specifically to CRP sites , CRP to bind to FNR sites . [9230919]

  • On the contrary , in vitro and in vivo studies with FLP have shown that it recognizes sequences conforming to a CCTGA N4 TCAGG consensus , which is related to but not congruent with either of the FNR or CRP consensus sequences ( Gostick et al. , 1998 ) . [11407111]

  • A sequence in PhlyE ( -69 TTTGATATTTATCATA-54 ) more closely resembles the FNR consensus ( NTTGATNNNNATCAAN ) than the CRP consensus ( TGTGANNNNNNTCACA ) , and in vivo transcription studies revealed that although FNR occupies PhlyE more frequently than CRP , the latter is a more efficient activator of hlyE expression ( Wyborn et al. , 2004b ) . [17892462]
  • FNR is structurally related to CRP and , like CRP , binds to a 22bp sequence that accommodates two FNR subunits ( Green et al. , 1991 ; Sharrocks et aL , 1991 ) . [8748035]
  • In genes which are activated by FNR , the consensus apparently replaces the canonical ' -35 ' region of the standard C ~ Nevertheless , FNR-dependent promoters seem to be recognized by RNA-polymerase containing oTM ( Sawers et al. 1989 ; Jayaraman et al. 1989 ) . [1854188]
  • The FNR protein has been shown to be necessary and responsible for the induction of expression of many anaerobic genes ( Lambden and Guest , 1976 ; Stewart , 1982 ; Newman and Cole , 1978 ; Sawers and Bock , 1988 ) while NtrA is an alternate sigma factor species ( Hirschman ef al. , 1985 ; Hunt and Magasanik , 1985 ) enabling RNA polymerase to recognize promoters showing a consensus GG/GC sequence lying at - 2 4 / - 1 2 b p with respect to the initiation site of transcription -LCB- Gussin et al. . [2181234]
  • The key features of this inverted-repeat are the A -- T base pairs at positions +7 and 27 ( underlined ) , which allow discrimination between FNR sites and sites recognized by related proteins , and the G -- C base pairs at +5 and 25 ( bold ) , which form a core interaction with the DNA recognition helices of this family of transcription factors ( Schultz et al. , 1991 ; Spiro et al. , 1990 ) . [17464064]
  • The -10 6/6 derivative carries a consensus -10 element , the -35 4/6 derivative matches four out of six bases of the -35 consensus element and the FNR con derivative has a consensus DNA site for FNR ( Guest et al. , 1996 ) . [15978080]
  • The activation of FNR similarly promotes site-specific DNA-binding , and a consensus FNR recognition motif was identified by comparing the sequences of well-characterized FNR-dependent promoters ( Eiglmeier et al. , 1989 ; Spiro and Guest , 1990 ; Guest et al. , 1996 ) . [11407111]
  • DNA binding and gene regulation by FNR Upstream regions of FNR-regulated genes are characterized by FNR consensus sequences of dyad symmetry ( TTGAT -- -- -- -- ATCAA ) ( Bell et al. 1989 ; Eiglmeier et al. 1989 ) . [8588737]
  • The DNA sequence recognized by FNR consists of an inverted-repeat with a consensus TTGATnnnnATCAA ( Eiglmeier et al. , 1989 ) . [17464064]
  • Dimeric FNR binds at DNA sequences related to the consensus TTGATNNNNATCAA ( Eiglmeier et al. , 1989 ) . [20522491]
  • RESULTS Expression of the E. coli K-12 yfgF gene is driven from a class II FNR-dependent promoter The E. coli FNR protein recognizes and binds DNA sequences related to an established consensus ( TTGATNN-NNATCAA ) ( Eiglmeier et al. , 1989 ) . [20522491]
  • RESULTS Identiﬁcation of the yhjA gene as a member of the FNR regulon The E. coli FNR protein recognizes DNA sequences related to the FNR consensus ( TTGATnnnnATCAA ) ( Eiglmeier et al. , 1989 ) . [17464064]

  • Based on sequence homology with CRP ( 8 ) , FNR consists of a C-terminal DNA-binding domain , which recognizes specific sequences within FNR-controlled promoters ( 9 ) , and an Nterminal sensory domain containing 5 cysteine residues , 4 of which , Cys-20 , 23 , 29 , and 122 , but not Cys-16 , are essential for function ( 10 , 11 ) .   • TcbC does not functionally replace any of the tdc operon regulators Expression of the tdc operon is controlled directly by a number of positive transcriptional regulators , including CRP , IHF , TdcA and TdcR ( Wu et al. , 1992 ; Hagewood et al. , 1994 ) , as well as being controlled indirectly by FNR ( Chattopadhyay et al. , 1997 ) . [11251844]

  • As concluded previously by Gruer & Guest ( 1994 ) , the effect of FNR is not simply due to its known ability to activate arcA transcription ( Compan & Touati , 1994 ) . [9421904]
  • It is well established that narK and narGHJI are organized as two operons transcribed in the same orientation , but with 500 bp of intergenic DNA that includes a rho-independent narK transcription terminator , and binding sites for regulation by the oxygen-responsive transcription factor , FNR , and the nitrate -- nitrite-responsive two-component regulatory system , NarX -- NarL ( Stewart & Parales , 1988 ; Kolesnikow et al. , 1992 ) . [16804183]

[8065261]
  • Conversely , although the arcA and adhE promoters include almost consensus FNR sites located appropriately to activate transcription , regulation by FNR is masked by other more significant factors that also regulate transcription positively or negatively . [16377617]
  • Whereas the effect on Fur and FNR caused transcription alterations in the genes under their control , that of SoxR was unexpected ; although a large increase upon the transcription of soxS occurred , a corresponding increase on the SoxRS regulon could not be detected . [15546870]
  • It has also been shown that FNR induces an 82-92 ° bend in target DNA ( Ziegelhoffer and Kiley , 1995 ) but , as with CRP , factor-medi-ated DNA bending may not be essential tbr transcription activation . [11407111]

  • Accordingly , caiF transcription appears to be positively controlled by FNR ( Eichler et al. , 1996 ) . [10564497]
  • These results indicate that repression by nitrate is independent of the three transcription factors ArcA , IHF , and FNR . [7601827]
  • Expression from this promoter is totaiiy dependent on the transcription factor , FNR , which binds between positions -52 and -30 upstream of the transcription startsite . [8437517]
  • Induction of nrdDG transcription is dependent on the FNR system but is independent of the ArcAB two-compo-nent system ( 8 ) . [17496099]
  • Nitrate-independent transcription of moeA-lacZ was repressed by the FNR protein , which also protected moe operator DNA from DNase I hydrolysis . [11357510]
  • The unbound FNR protein in the cell can bind to lower affinity targets including moe DNA and repress its transcription when the demand for Mo-cofactor and Moe proteins is low . [11357510]
  • Furthermore , upon the addition of FNR , transcription of the narX promoter was significantly repressed ( Fig. 4A and B ) , 250 nM FNR exhibiting approximately 90 % repression . [8119409]
  • In addition to the specific repression by the FNR protein , the significant decrease in transcription of the fnr and narX genes was also noticed even in the absence of FNR by truncation of respective upstream sequences . [8119409]
  • The current microarray data confirmed 32 of these 43 assignments , but alone did not confirm FNR activation of five operons ( adhE , glpTQ , cydDC , hlyE and arcA ) or FNR repression of six operons ( hemA , narXL , tpx , yeiL , norVW and ubiCA ) . [16417494]
  • As evidenced by the lysis of erythrocytes in agar ( Table 3 ) , the absence of CRP , but not of FNR , reduced the level of clyA derepression in anaerobically grown hns strains . [11053378]
  • It was anticipated that any disruption by NO of FNR might reduce its inducing activity on FF ( ± 71.5 ) : : lacZ and derepress the FFgalD4 : : lacZ promoter fusion . [12093725]
  • Activationof the E. coil ansB promoter,CC-FF , and its derivative FF-FF , by mutant FNR or CRP . [8748035]
  • Expressionof the E. coil ansB promoter,CC-FF , in the presenceand absence of CRP and FNR . [8748035, 8748035]
  • Expression in fnr + strain Expression in fnr m utant + Nitrate + Nitrite + Nitrate + Nitrite Example Regulatory subgroup 150 175 0.4 2.5 0.03 60.4 7.8 76 29.9 38.5 8.8 47.8 4.7 3.8 1.7 20.4 51.4 15.5 42.9 0.3 87.5 5.2 hmpA ytfE Repressed by FNR ; induced by both nitrate and nitrite 129 0.2 1.6 0.03 14.6 9.5 Activated by FNR ; induced by both nitrate and nitrite nirB hcp nrfA yeaR-yoaG yibIH Activated by FNR ; repressed by NarL but activated by NarP Induced by nitrate ; strongly induced by nitrite in an fnr mutant In summary , we have exploited at least five critical factors that limited previous attempts to define the FNR regulon of E. coli . [16417494]
  • Operons in this group include frdA and dmsA , both of which are known to be subject to hierarchical control by FNR and NarL in response to oxygen and nitrate ( 32 , 33 ) . [16377617]
  • The YtfE protein was recently implicated in the NO stress response [ 14 ] : in parallel with hmpA , ytfE transcription is strongly induced by nitrate , repressed by FNR and optimally expressed in an fnr mutant during growth in the presence of nitrite ( Table 1 ) . [16417494]
  • Conversely , transcription of both the nap and nrf operons is totally dependent on FNR , repressed by nitrate but induced by nitrite , effectively providing protection against NO generated in the anaerobic gastrointestinal tract where nitrate is a scarce but valuable electron acceptor . [16417494]
  • Only five operons were induced by nitrate , NarXL and NarP , two of which were also activated by FNR . [16377617]
  • Transcription initiation at the nrfA promoter is activated by FNR in the absence of oxygen and induced further by NarL and NarP in response to low concentrations of nitrate or to nitrite ( 35 , 44 ) . [17449618]
  • Transcription from the hmp and ytfE promoters appeared to be repressed by FNR but strongly induced by both nitrate and nitrite . [16377617]
  • Appropriately , both are anaerobically induced by FNR and repressed by NarL in response to nitrate ( 14 , 17 ) , thus ensuring that oxygen and nitrate are utilized in preference to fumarate as terminal electron acceptors . [9852003]
  • Transcription of the four operons encoding nitrate and nitrite reductases in enteric bacteria is totally dependent upon FNR , the regulator of fumarate and nitrate reduction ( Table 3 ; Fig. 1 ) . [22029434]
  • Expression of two other operons encoding proteins of unknown function , YeaR-YoaG and YibIH , is induced strongly by nitrite only in the absence of FNR ( Table 1 ) . [16417494]
  • Transcription of a further group of genes , including yeaR , yoaG , yibH , and yibI encoding proteins of unknown function , is partially FNR-dependent and strongly induced by nitrate but also strongly induced by nitrite in an FNR mutant , suggesting that multiple regulatory circuits regulate the response of these genes to nitrate and nitrite . [16377617]
  • Furthermore , despite being repressed by FNR and ArcA ( 22 ) , fumA did not meet the criteria set for responsive transcripts at any of the time points . [16857675]
  • It is now apparent from studies with the corresponding l a c 2 fusions that the fumA promoter resembles PacnBin being anaerobically repressed by ArcA , whereas the fumC promoter resembles P2acnAin its dual regulation by ArcA and FNR , although there is evidence that fumC transcription is partially facilitated by readthrough from the upstream fumA gene promoter ( Woods & Guest , 1987 ; Guest & Russell , 1992 ; Gruer & Guest , 1994 ; Park & Gunsalus , 1995 ) . [9421904]
  • Transcription of the glp operons is subject to multiple controls , including catabolite repression mediated by cyclic AMP-CRP and respiratory control mediated by the FNR and ArcA/ArcB systems ( 19 , 28 ) . [8955387]
  • This showed that the acnB gene is subject to repression by ArcA , Fis and FruR and activation by CRP , whereas the a c n A gene is repressed by ArcA and FNR , activated by FruR , CRP , Fur and SoxRS , and initiated by a38in stationary phase . [9421904]
  • Both genes are subject to ArcA-mediated anaerobicrepression and CRP-mediated catabolite repression , but they differ insofar as a c n A gene transcription is activated by Fur , SoxRS and FruR , can be initiated by t ~ a ~ d ~ is r , epressed by FNR , whereas the acnB gene is repressed by Fis and FruR but unaffected by the other regulators . [9421904, 9421904]
  • Expressionfrom the suc promoter was repressed by IHF and partially activated by d8but it was not regulated by ArcA , FNR , CRP , FruR or Fis , and not repressed by glucose or anaerobiosis , indicating that the well-established catabolite and anaerobic repression of ODH synthesis is imposed elsewhere . [9720032]
  • Incontrast , the / pel promoter was repressed by both glucose ( via a CRP-independentmechanism ) and anaerobiosis ( mediated by ArcA ) , and activated by Fis , but it was not regulated by FNR , FruR , IHF or These observations support the view that transcription of the sucABCD genes is primarily initiated and regulated at the upstream sdh promoter , and that the Ipd promoter is independently co-regulated with Pdh ( primarily by ArcAmediated repression ) rather than with PsucDirect evidence for co-transcription of the entire sdhCDAksucABCD region from PHNw t as obtained by detecting a 10 kb transcript inm c and me mutants , but not inthe parental strains . [9720032]

  • Another example is the promoter of the nrfA operon that is activated by FNR and repressed by Fis and IHF . [17233826]
  • These data clearly indicate that the hcp promoter is activated by FNR and repressed by NsrR . [17449618]
  • Fourteen operons , including fnr itself , were previously considered to be repressed by FNR . [16377617]
  • All of the seven operons that were both previously reported and confirmed in the current experiments to be repressed by FNR were induced by nitrate in the fnr mutant . [16377617]
  • A comprehensive literature search revealed that there is previous independent biochemical or genetic evidence that 29 operons are activated and 14 operons are repressed by FNR . [16417494]
  • Forty four operons not previously known to be included in the FNR regulon were activated by FNR , and a further 28 operons appeared to be repressed . [16377617]
  • Similar explanations apply to the six operons that we failed to confirm to be FNR-repressed ; no credible FNR sites are located in the hemA or norVW promoters ( the latter is an RpoN-dependent promoter ) , and putative sites in the ubiCA , yeiL , and tpx promoters diverge from the consensus . [16377617]
  • Consequently , changes in expression levels of operons known from a range of genetic , biochemical , and in vitro data to be dependent upon FNR activation were not detected in the previous studies , and the nirB promoter in which there is a consensus binding site for FNR activation even appeared to be repressed by FNR ( 1 ) . [16377617]

  • Regulatory patterns III ( anaerobically repressed , not affected by FNR ) and IV ( anaerobically activated , not affected by FNR ) are most easily explained as genes affected by the ArcAB system or as yet unidentified global regulators such as Lrp , IHF , FIS , or H-NS . [12754220]

( 2 ) included many ArcA-regulated operons in their lists of genes activated or repressed by FNR . [16377617]

  • In addition , the expression of cyoABCDE ( 18 ) , sucABCD , sdhCDAB ( 63 ) , sodA ( 31 ) , tpx ( 41 ) , fumA ( 65 ) , and icdA ( 15 ) was shown to be negatively regulated by both FNR and ArcA under anaerobi conditions . [15659690]
  • Consistently , anaerobically sodA as well as metE expression was known to be negatively regulated by FNR though an undetermined mechanism ( 32 , 34 ) . [20075074]
  • Alternatively , it is conceivable that genF and fumB are both expressed from an FNR-regulated promoter situated upstream of genF or that FNR exerts an indirect effect on fumB expression . [2656658]
  • The results of the gene expression profiling experiments further show that as many as two-thirds of the genes whose expression levels are affected by the ArcA protein are also affected by the FNR protein ( 1 ) . [15699038]
  • Group VI : genes that are repressed by FNR but that do not show any O2-dependent changes in gene expression . [15659690]
  • The majority of other ArcA or FNR regulated genes studied so far are either repressed anaerobically by ArcA or activated anaerobically by FNR , although three examples are known whose expression is repressed by FNR anaerobically ( 14 , 24 ) . [1592804]
  • The large number of genes whose expression is regulated by changes in O2 and the dramatic reprogramming of metabolic pathways have made the study of FNR and its regulon ideal for a system level approach . [17293415]
  • Despite the vast abundance of genes that are regulated by the FNR and ArcAB systems , it appears that they do not represent the sole means by which gene expression in E. coli is regulated in response to oxygen levels ( Sawers , 1999 ) . [11251844]
  • In Azotobacter vinelandii , expression of the ﬂhDC genes ( which encode the master regulator of motility ) is negatively regulated by the oxygen-sensor CydR , an orthologue of the E. coli FNR protein ( León and Espín , 2008 ) . [19656291]
  • Components of the 02-sensingsystem of FNR Conclusions In E. coli the expression of O2-regulated genes is controlled by different regulatory systems . [1854188]
  • Ninety-one genes with no presently deﬁned function were also altered in expression , including seven of the most highly anaerobically induced genes , six of which we found to be directly regulated by FNR . [15659690]
  • Of the remaining genes clustered into this expression pattern , two genes , mrcA ( penicillin-binding protein 1A ) and rarD ( involved in chloramphenicol resistance ) , were also observed to be regulated by FNR ( 1 ) . [15699038]
  • Two other genes , organized in an operon encoding a putative alternative cytochrome oxidase , appCB ( cbdAB ) , were not observed previously to be regulated by FNR ( 1 ) , and xylR ( regulatory gene for the xylose operon ) also clustered into this expression pattern . [15699038]
  • The likely explanation for this is that most of the genes controlled by these promoters encode products that play a role in anaerobic respiration of nitrate and nitrite , and thus their expression is fully induced only in both the absence of oxygen ( signalled via FNR ) and the presence of nitrate or nitrite ( signalled by NarL ) [ 4,29,30 ] . [19245365]
  • Expression Pattern II : Increased Expression during Anaerobiosis and Decreased Expression in an FNR Strain -- The transcription of the 58 genes of expression pattern II ( Table II ) are both induced in the absence of oxygen and positively regulated by FNR . [12754220]
  • The aerobic requirement for FNR is surprising because the iron ^ sulfur-con-taining holo-FNR protein activates the expression of an-aerobic genes in response to oxygen-starvation , but does not bind at these target promoters when oxygen is available ( reviewed in [ 8 ^ 11 ] ) . [14612240]

  • The in vivo analysis of a yfcZ-lacZ fusion strain revealed that the expression of yfcZ was not as strongly regulated by FNR , in agreement with the microarray data ( data not shown ) . [15659690]

  • However , our data showing that NO does not regulate # rd suggest that the mechanism of repression exerted by the transcription factor FNR on the # rd operon is clearly di ¡ erent from that on the hmp gene , which is proposed to be upregulated by NO through FNR inhibition [ 17,23 ] . [12586421]

  • Previous studies using an fdhF : : lacZ gene fusion confirm that its transcription is activated anaerobically in the presence of FNR ( 33 ) . [12754220]
  • Expression of the caiF gene is dependent on the same general regulatory proteins , H-NS , CRP , FNR , and transcription factor RpoN ( 11 ) , which control cai and ﬁx expression ( Table 2 ) ( 10 ) . [9573142]
  • For example , H-NS is known to interfere with ss and Lrp in transcription of the osmC gene ( 8 ) and with FNR and CAP in the regulation of cai and ﬁx operons ( 11 ) . [10601207]
  • Like cai and ﬁx operons , the caiF gene appeared to be positively controlled by CRP and FNR and negatively controlled by H-NS and the NarL ( plus nitrate ) regulator . [9573142]
  • Indeed , the homology between FNR and CRP is such that their DNA-binding specificities can be interconverted by appropriate substitutions in the recognition helices , such that catabolite repression can be lifted in response to anoxia and anaerobic gene activation can be induced by glucose starvation ( cAMP ) ] 7 . [1957353]
  • The dcuB gene is strongly activated anaerobically by FNR , repressed in the presence of nitrate by NarL , and subject to cyclic AMP receptor protein ( CRP ) - mediated catabolite repression . [9852003]
  • The results show that the dcuB gene is expressed exclusively under anaerobic conditions in a manner that is FNR dependent and that it is repressed by NarL in the presence of nitrate and is subject to CRP-mediated catabolite repression . [9852003]
  • The dcuB gene is expressed exclusively under anaerobic conditions in a manner that is largely FNR dependent , is repressed by nitrate through a mechanism that is mostly NarL mediated , and is strongly induced by C4-dicar-boxylates anaerobically . [9852003]

  • TorC autoregulation is different from tor anaerobic control The torCAD operon is fully induced in anaerobiosis but , in contrast to all other known anaerobic respiratory systems , this control is mediated neither by FNR , a pleiotropic anae-robic regulator , nor by ArcA , a response regulator involved in redox control of numerous genes ( Simon et al. , 1994 ) .   • Such is the case for complex II in E. coli , with the complex II bio-synthetic operon ( sdhCDAB ) being negatively regulated by ArcAB and FNR in response to oxygen conditions ( i.e. anaerobic ) and positively regulated by CRP in the absence of glucose [ 108 -- 110 ] . [22985599]

  • FNR is required for anaerobic induction of narGHJI , fdnGHI , and frdABCD . [2066339]
  • FNR is located in the cytoplasm and contains a [ 4Fe -- 4S ] cluster in the active ( anaerobic ) state . [11931557]
  • The reduced uptake rates in an fnr background and under aerobic conditions suggest that the synthesis is under ( direct or indirect ) transcriptional control of FNR , the transcriptional regulator of anaerobic respiratoxy genes ( reviewed in references 25 and 29 ) . [1512189]
  • Under the same conditions FNR represses some of the genes of aerobic respiration . [1854188]
  • ldhA is one of the shortest fermentation genes ( 991 nucleotides ) , it is not under control of FNR , and its product is present both under aerobic and anaerobic conditions ( Linch and Lin , 1996 ) . [16187334, 16187334]
  • The transcription of hlyE in the hns strain under anaerobic conditions in the presence of glucose is presumably driven by FNR alone . [14996792]
  • Furthermore , the anaerobic transcription of fnrS was abolished in a fnr strain , thus demonstrating that the global regulatory protein FNR induces FnrS transcription in response to anoxic growth conditions . [20075074]
  • Under aerobic growth conditions , proteolysis decreases FNR protein levels ( 12 , 38 ) , while under anaerobic conditions , FNR represses its own transcription ( 24 , 41 , 44 , 47 , 54 ) . [17293415]
  • Although much progress has been achieved in understanding what limits FNR function to anaerobic growth conditions ( Kiley and Beinert , 1999 ) , the mechanism by which FNR regulates transcription initiation of its target genes is not as well understood . [11115116]
  • FNR activates transcription of many genes in response to anaerobic conditions . [16417494]
  • FNR activates transcription of a number of genes coding for enzymes required under anaerobic growth conditions and represses transcription of some genes for aerobic functions ( 11 , 20 ) . [12923108]
  • FNR is selectively active as a transcription factor under anaerobic growth conditions , where it has been shown to control the transcription of hundreds of genes , many of which are necessary for adaptation to O2-limiting growth conditions ( 10 , 16 , 25 , 46 ) . [17293415]
  • Here it is shown that the oxygen-responsive transcription factor FNR regulates PhypA under anaerobic conditions only . [14612240]
  • Yet , FNR is only functional as a transcription factor under anaerobic growth conditions . [9990723]

  • Under anaerobic conditions , FNR binds to a site centred between positions 241 and 242 , activating transcription of the nir operon . [10972841]
  • Transport studies suggest that the Dcu systems are expressed exclusively under an-aerobic conditions , activated by the anaerobic activator protein FNR , and repressed in the presence of nitrate . [9852003]

  • To determine if negative autoregulation requires the [ 4Fe-4S ] form of FNR , expression of Pfnr - lacZ ( bp 155 to 25 of Pfnr relative to the transcription start site ) was monitored in anaerobically grown strains expressing either wild-type FNR or FNR mutants ( FNR-CA23 and FNRCA122 ) that were previously shown to not contain [ 4Fe-4S ] clusters ( 29 , 32 , 34 , 37 , 50 , 53 ) . [11053378]

  • However , it is shown that two FNR half-site motifs located upstream of the c70-de-pendent promoter are necessary for FNR-mediated hypB-E expression in vivo . [14612240]
  • However , even in the absence of FNR , we were unable to detect a transcript in our in vitro transcription system using a template that contained the same upstream sequences , suggesting that expression of the talA promoter may require additional factors or that it is a weak promoter ( data not shown ) . [15659690]
  • Previous work has shown that the global transcription factors FNR and CRP positively regulate hlyE expression by binding at the same site . [14996792]
  • Footprinting studies have shown that FNR and CRP activate hlyE expression from the same site centered 61.5 bp upstream of the SlyA-associated transcription start site ( 10 , 36 ) . [14996792]
  • During aerobic growth , transcription from the nir and nrf promoters is repressed , but expression is induced during anaerobiosis due to activation by the anaerobically regulated transcription factor FNR ( Jayaraman et al. 1989 ; Bell et al. 1990 ; Page et al. 1990 ) . [9382703]
  • This pattern of expression results from positive regulation of transcription from the narGHJI operon by three transacting factors , FNR , NARL , and integration host factor ( IHF ) ( 16 ) . [8682807]
  • It is clear that E. coii contains a family of anaerobically regulated promoters where expression is dependent on at least two transcription factors , FNR and NarL/NarP . [7854119]
  • The regulation of yhjA expression is interesting , because transcription is dependent on two transcription factors , FNR and OxyR , that respond to two seemingly incompatible signals , i.e. oxygen starvation and peroxide stress . [17464064]
  • In a number of cases , activation by FNR is modulated by further transcription factors which establish priorities between the expression of different anaerobically expressed operons ( reviewed by luchi and Un , 1993 ) . [7854119]
  • It has also been suggested that the oxygenresponsive transcription factor FNR activates expression of ompW ( 7 ) , although direct evidence for FNR interaction with the ompW promoter is lacking . [21252224]
  • Anaerobic expression of yfgF is dependent on the transcription factor FNR . [20522491]
  • In vitro transcription from promoter indicated that FNR alone can dow yfiD expression . [11169114]
  • Titration of the FNR and PurR transcription factors by the high copy number clone is expected to increase the expression level of genes normally suppressed by these two regulators . [22152010]
  • Thus , while it seems likely that FNR does not directly effect transcription of these genes , the decrease in expression in fnr strains remains unexplained . [15659690]
  • The FNR protein induces expression anaerobically , and evidence indicates that it probably binds to a specific recognition sequence located around position -40 bp relative to the transcription initiation site ( 41 ) . [8376324]
  • The FNR box is therefore in a position which is not indicative of anaerobic activation of transcription by an FNR-like protein and understanding of its role must await further study . [7747934]
  • Furthermore , the anaerobic expression of FUMB is reduced infnr mutants and amplified by a multicopy fnr plasmid ( 37 ) , which is consistent with FUMB being an anaerobic enzyme requiring the anaerobic transcription factor ( FNR ; 23 , 24 ) for expression . [2656658]

  • In a mutant deficient in FNR ( encoded by the fnr gene ) , the transcriptional activator of anaerobic respiratory genes , fumarate uptake was decreased by a factor of 5.3 compared with that of the parental strain . [1512189]
  • Anaerobic regulation is mediated by the fnr gene product , FNR , which is a positive activator required for the transcription of a number of anaerobic genes ( reviewed in references 31 and 34 ) . [2066339]
  • Expression of the aspA gene is repressed by glucose ( ; 10-fold ) under aerobic conditions and enhanced anaerobically ( ; 10-fold ) in a manner which is partially ( ; 2-fold ) FNR dependent ( 16 , 44 ) . [9852003]

  • Expression of the fumB gene is activated under anaerobic conditions by FNR ( 37 ) . [2656658]
  • Discussion The ndh gene is an unusual member of the FNR reguion because it is repressed rather than being activated under anaerobic conditions , and KMnO4 footprinting studies have now shown that RNA polymerase can not form an open complex at the ndh promoter in the presence of FNR . [8065261]

  • Expression of the ndh gene , which encodes NADH dh II , is repressed by FNR under anaerobic conditions ( 15 , 40 ) . [7730262]
  • Using reverse-transcription polymerase chain reaction we show that although the flavorubredoxin gene ( flrd ) is transcribed in both aerobic and anaerobic conditions , anaerobiosis induced transcription up to 12-fold , under fermentative conditions ; a 28-fold stimulation was observed in an E. coli fnr mutant strain , showing that the flavorubredoxin gene is negatively regulated by FNR . [12586421]
  • The FNRsystem The product of the fnr gene ( FNR ) is now known to be involved in the anaerobic activation or repression of a variety of enzymes , and it may also repress its own transcription under anaerobic conditions ( Fig. 3 ) 6 . [1957353]
  • The proposed interaction of FNR , the product of the fnr gene , and RNA polymer-ase ( RNP ) under conditions in which frd transcription is induced or not induced is shown . [3298218]
  • Under aerobic conditions with excess glucose , control of sdhCDAB -- b0725 -- sucABCD transcription by Arc , FNR , FruR and cAMP-CRP will play a minor role and , thus , reduced expression of this operon during glucose overflow metab-olism is likely due to the control by the cAMP-CRP independent catabolite control system . [17273855]
  • 2 To identify which genes of E. coli K-12 are differentially expressed under anaerobic conditions and to determine the role of FNR in this process , we compared changes in transcript proﬁles of an FNR mutant with its wild-type parent , MG1655 , grown under both aerobic and anaerobic conditions . [15659690]
  • It has been reported that FNR is able to sense oxygen directly ( 47 ) , while the ArcB/ArcA system responds to the content of the quinone pool ( 4 , 5 , 17 ) and switches on the expression of fermentation genes and represses aerobic pathways when E. coli encounters low-oxy-gen growth conditions ( 21 , 22 ) . [20709841]
  • Analysis of these data demonstrated that the expression of over one-third of the genes expressed during growth under aerobic conditions are altered when E. coli cells transition to an an-aerobic growth state , and that the expression of 712 ( 49 % ) of these genes are either directly or indirectly modulated by FNR . [12754220]
  • Based on this analysis of whole genome transcription data , it was estimated that the expression of over one-third of the genes expressed during growth under aerobic conditions are altered when E. coli cells transition to an anaerobic growth state and that the expression of half of these genes is modulated either directly or indirectly by FNR . [15699038]
  • It was also concluded that any involvement of FNR must be indirect ( or operational only in the absence of ArcA ) , because a c n A expression was not enhanced in an fnr mutant , but it was partially repressed under aerobic conditions by fnr + amplification in an arcA + strain ( Gruer & Guest , 1994 ) . [9421904]
  • It is conceivable that in addition to FNR the frd promoter may be recognized by another anaerobic activator and in this respect it should be noted that other workers have reported significant anaerobic frd expression in fnr mutants ( Jones and Gunsalus , 1987 ; Spiro and Guest , 1988 ) . [2677602]
  • Anaerobic ndh expression is repressed by FNR but enhanced in fnr mutants during anaerobic growth in rich medium ( Spiroet al. , 1989 ; Green & Guest , 1994 ) . [9308170]
  • CHR activity was always high because the cai operon ( responsible for the expression of carnitine metabolism ) was controlled by protein regulators such as FNR ( transcriptional regulator under anaerobic conditions ) , catabolic repression via protein receptor ( CRP ) of AMPc , histones ( H-NS ) , and the transcriptional factor j 2 ( RpoS ) , which is expressed when the cell reaches the stationary phase of growth and inhibits carnitine metabolism ( Eichler et al. , 1996 ) . [14595781]
  • Although the array data presented in Table VII indicate that nirB expression is decreased during anaerobic growth , a lacZ transcriptional fusion showed that expression of the nirBDC operon is activated by FNR during anaerobic cell growth ( 44 , 45 ) . [12754220]
  • However , a mutation in fnr did not affect anaerobic expression of an ( cydD-lacZ ) operon fusion , suggesting that FNR repression is indirect and mediated at the post-transcriptional level ( 61 ) . [20075074]
  • In contrast , the expression of fumB resembles that of the fumarate reductase operon and some other ` anaerobic ' genes in being depressed anaerobically by a mechanism that involves FNR , the CRP-like anaerobic transcriptional activator protein . [3282546]
  • Thus , moe operon expression is modulated at three levels : ( 1 ) an aerobic low level , ( 2 ) an anaerobic intermediate level controlled by ArcA-P and FNR ( supporting FHL and DMSO reductase ) , and ( 3 ) by ArcA-phosphate and NarL-phosphate , which , during nitrate respiration , control the highest level of moe operon expression . [11357510]
  • It is tempting to speculate that in the wild-type cell , low aerobic expression of gipA largely reflects activation by CAP , whereas the high anaerobic expression of the operon largely reflects activation by the FNR protein . [2403539]
  • 3474 RESULTS AND DISCUSSION ArcA and FNR are required for complete anaerobic pfl operon expression . [1592804]
  • It was clear from previous studies that a functional FNR protein was not the sole factor responsible for the anaerobic induction of the pfl operon expression ( 20 , 21 ) . [1592804]
  • In ECL515 ( frd-4 ) anaerobic expression is not significantly influenced by FNR whereas ECL516 ( frd-5 ) produced 1.5-fold more enzyme in an fnr ' background unlike the fr & allele which synthesized four-fold more fumarate reducatase in response to FNR . [2677602]
  • The fnr strain , JRG1728 , failed to produce a detectable yﬁD transcript in both exponential ( not shown ) and stationary-phase cultures , indicating that all yﬁD expression is FNR dependent . [9767578]
  • The twofold anaerobic induction of the dcuA-lacZ fusion was unaffected by the fnr deletion ( data not shown ) , revealing that FNR has no role in dcuA expression . [9852003]
  • This increase in anaerobic expression does not appear to be FNR dependent , as shown by the fact that strains lacking FNR showed no differences from the FNR strain in transcript levels . [15659690]
  • In each case , anaerobic induction was dependent on FNR since expression was negligible in the JRG1728 fnr strain ( data not shown ) . [18757534]
  • We ﬁnd that the major regulator of yﬁD expression is FNR , but that yﬁD expression is induced at the level of transcription during growth under acidic conditions . [11932447]
  • That FNR is the major transcription regulator of yﬁD expression was conﬁrmed by Western blotting , which showed that extracts of an fnr mutant strain ( JRG1728 ) grown anaerobically at pH 7 ± 2 contained very little YﬁD protein compared to the parent strain , indicating that anaerobic expression of yﬁD under these conditions is FNR dependent ( Fig. 1 ) . [11932447]
  • Although previous studies demonstrated that FNR is inactivated by the presence of O2 , expression of glnK and yedL decreased under aerobic growth conditions in an fnr mutant compared to the wild-type strain . [15659690]
  • The fnr mutant , lacking the O2-responsive regulator FNR , was completely devoid of dcuC9-9lacZ expression during aerobic and anaerobic growth . [10368146]
  • The suggestion that the acid-responsive yﬁD expression is independent of FNR was supported by Western blot analyses of cell-free extracts of MC1000 ( pGS1000 ) ( fnr + ) and JRG1728 ( pGS1000 ) ( ∆ fnr ) prepared after aerobic and anaerobic growth at pH 7 ± 2 in the presence or absence of benzoate . [11932447]
  • The data revealed that both FNR and CRP made signiﬁcant positive contributions to hlyE expression , whereas the hns mutation resulted in slightly reduced hlyE transcription under these conditions ( Fig. 1a ) . [14996792]
  • The ﬁndings that SlyA does not enhance hlyE expression in hns cultures grown in liquid medium under anaerobic conditions and that SlyA appears unable to activate hlyE expression in the absence of FNR and CRP and the determination of the location of the region of PhlyE occupied by SlyA ( Fig. 6 ) suggest that SlyA activates hlyE expression by antagonizing the negative action of H-NS . [14996792]
  • The Arc-activated cydAB ( 1 ) , and Arc-repressed sodA ( 13 ) and lpdA ( 26 ) , are also under the direct negative control of FNR , a regulator that co-mediates gene expression in response to the redox conditions of growth ( 38 ) . [14711822]
  • The ndh gene is normally expressed under aerobic conditions when FNR is inactive . [14766919]
  • The results presented in Table 4 show that the residual FNR protein-independent expression of the CC fusion construct was eliminated by the Acrp mutation , irrespective of growth conditions . [1629153]
  • The lpd ( lpdA ) gene , encoding lipoamide dehydrogenase , a member of the phdR-aceEF-lpdA operon ( Fig. 6 ) , shows a 4.8-fold decrease in expression when grown under anaerobic conditions and a 11.4-fold increase in the FNR deletion strain . [12754220]
  • The FNR strain had half as much - Gal activity as the strain lacking FNR , suggesting that FNR does repress rpoS expression under an-aerobic conditions . [15659690]
  • The aim of the work described here was to further characterise the role of FNR in regulating hyp expression under aerobic and anaerobic conditions . [14612240]
  • The transcription factor FNR ( for fumarate and nitrate reduction ) plays a major role in altering gene expression between aerobic and anaerobic conditions to facilitate such changes in energy metabolism . [9990723]
  • Results The starting point for this work was the report that the c70-dependent hyp operon promoter ( PhypA ) requires the anaerobic transcription factor FNR for expression under aerobic and anaerobic conditions [ 6 ] . [14612240]
  • The expression of hmp is highly induced by NO under aerobic and anaerobic conditions , through a complex regulation that involves at least three regulators , namely , FNR , MetR , and the NO-sensitive repressor NsrR ( 3 , 9 , 30 ) . [22563051]
  • Evidently , CRP , and not FNR , was required for the expression of ClyA in hns mutants under anoxic conditions , although it appeared that FNR could partly complement CRP . [11053378]
  • Simply avoiding the use of the repressing carbon source , glucose , allowed the FNR dependence of the nrf and nap promoters to be demonstrated , even under growth conditions that were suboptimal for expression . [16377617]
  • Therefore , the enhanced expression of yfiD under microaerobic conditions is dependent on the presence of a high-affinity activating FNR site ( 240.5 ) and a lower affinity repressing FNR site ( 293.5 ) . [11169114]
  • The expression of fumB is activated under anaerobic conditions by the anaerobic transcriptional regulator , FNR ( 37 ) , and potential FNR-binding sites were sought by using a 12-bp symmetrical consensus , TGATA - - TATCAA , based on that proposed by Spiro and Guest ( 25 ; S. Spiro , M. H. Todd , P. J. Artynfliuk , and J. R. Guest , Biochem . [2656658]
  • Thus , expression of ttdA requires transcriptional activation by FNR , which is in the active state only under anaerobic conditions ( Guest et al. , 1996 ) . [19661178]
  • During anaerobic growth , transcription of the hmp gene is repressed by FNR , but severe exposure to NO stress results in inactivation of FNR and hence de-repression of hmp expression [ 18 ] . [16417494]
  • The uncertainty arises because hmp expression is repressed by FNR , and this repression is relieved during anaerobic growth under conditions of severe nitrosative stress ( Table 1 ; Cruz-Ramos et al. , 2002 ; Corker & Poole , 2003 ; Pullan et al. , 2007 ) . [22029434]
  • This suggests that during anaerobic growth in liquid cultures in the absence of glucose , FNR is the major regulator of hlyE expression , and that CRP-mediated hlyE expression requires the presence of H-NS . [14996792]
  • During anaerobic growth the fumarate and nitrate reduction regulator ( FNR ) was important for ClyA expression , and the clyA gene could be activated by overexpression of FNR . [11053378]
  • However , in the absence of FNR , ndh expression is activated by the amino acid response regulator ( Arr ) during anaerobic growth in rich medium . [9308170]
  • Despite the activation of the repressors ArcA and FNR by the withdrawal of oxygen in the aerobic -- anaerobic transition , ndh expression did not decrease ( figure 6b ) , consistent with the microarray data ( figure 4c ) . [22870390]
  • expression is controlled by the FNR protein ( Page et ai . [7934939]
  • Both types are expressed only during anaerobic growth and , in Escheri-chia coti , expression is dependent on the FNR protein ( Page et ai . [8057835]

  • Group I : genes whose expression is increased under anaerobic conditions and whose activation is FNR dependent . [15659690]
  • Group II : genes whose expression appears to be repressed by FNR under anaerobic conditions . [15659690]
  • Group III : genes whose expression is decreased under an-aerobic conditions and whose repression is partially FNR dependent . [15659690]
  • Group VIII : genes whose expression is increased under an-aerobic conditions and whose activation is FNR independent . [15659690]

  • In the Gram negative bacterium Escherichia coli , this process is primarily controlled by the global transcription regulator FNR ( fumarate and nitrate reduction ) which is activated under anaerobic conditions and upon activation , regulates the expression of more than one hundred genes in E. coli genome [ 1,2 ] .   • Summary In Escherichia coli , the anaerobic expression of genes encoding the nitrate ( narGHJI ) and dimethyl sulphoxide ( dmsABC ) terminal reductases is stimulated by the global anaerobic regulator FNR . [11115116]
  • Our studies have focused on understanding the role of FNR in activating expression of the genes encoding the anaerobic terminal reductases for nitrate , narGHJI ( Stewart and Rabin , 1995 ) , and dimethyl sulphoxide , dmsABC ( Cotter and Gunsalus , 1989 ) . [11115116]
  • Introduction The expression of genes required for anaerobic growth of Escherichia coli is tightly controlled , and many such genes are reguiated by the FNR protein , a transcription factor that is activated by the absence of oxygen in the medium ( reviewed by Spiro and Guest , 1990 ) . [8437517]
  • Introduction In Escherichia coli , the transcription factor FNR facilitates adaptation to anaerobic growth conditions by regulating the expression of gene products that are involved in anaerobic energy metabolism ( Spiro and Guest , 1990 ) . [11115116]
  • The Escherichia coli K-12 nrf operon encodes the NrfA periplasmic nitrite reductase ( 9 ) , and its expression is controlled by a single promoter ( pnrf ) whose activity is completely dependent on FNR , the principal global transcription regulator responsible for anaerobic adaptation ( 26 ) . [20472787]
  • Repression of in vitro transcription of the Escherichia coli fnr and narX genes by R protein The expression of respiratory genes in E. coli is controlled by two trandscriptional regulatory systems : one is the ArcB/A system for aerobic genes [ l ] ; and the other is the FNR system for anaerobic genes [ 2 ] . [8119409]
  • Here , we extend this view by the identification and characterization of a highly conserved , anaerobically induced small sRNA in E. coli , whose expression is strictly dependent on the anaerobic transcriptional fumarate and nitrate reductase regulator ( FNR ) . [20075074]
  • In this work we report on the identification and characterization of a highly conserved , anaerobically induced sRNA in E. coli , whose expression is strictly dependent on FNR . [20075074]

[18683632]
